Such an amazing experience! The room was so cosy and yet so intimate and chic, the exquisite taste of the food and beverages, but the details that made it all so unique were definitely the staff!
Special thanks to Alice, a perfect example of dedication, professionalism, hospitality and passionate work poured into every day presence at CitizenM!
Thank you and see you soon!
I really had a cozy and comfortable stay their. The receptionists Nour,  Isabela, Nwanah took good care of me and my family and made our visit even enjoyable! I really loved them.

My second stay at Citizen M was even better than the first one because I knew what to expect and I wasnât disappointed: comfort and cordiality from the ambassadors. LOVE the concept, the deco, the shower and the bed, simply heaven!

Very nice stay.
I had a complimentary prosecco and a lovely card from the staff for my anniversary and we were very happy about that!
Very nice Room!!
I'll come back
Thank you very much for everything guys!!!
After years of search, I found my hotel in Paris. Great and modern room, super comfortable bed and fluffy towels. Lovely rooftop bar.

Amazing Hotel experiance with CitizenM. Got a great welcome from one of the employees with all the nessesary explenation. CitizenM gives you a Smart Hotel room fully controlled by an Ipad. The room was clean, modern and has a realy great shower. Vieuw is perfect and easy acces through subway. full 5 star rating for citizenM

Perfectly located both for central Paris and easy access to transport
Top notch friendly service and great bar/ communal area

My favourite hotel for many many many reasons. It is comfy. Staff is amazing. The concept is so nice.
Only the food is average. The rest is outstanding.

reasonably priced, no fuzz hotel with a young crowd. the rooftop bar (for hotel guests only) has great views of the seine including the eiffel tower, and reasonably priced cocktails, wine, and beer. location next to gare de lyon is easy to reach from CDG airport, and offers access to the metro for easy sightseeing.
Love Citzen M's. So well designed.. fast and simple to get in and out. Everything you need in the room... but still would like a Mini-bar and room service with current curfews.
The staff was friendly and location was very convenient, breakfast is also delicious
Great location just steps away from the train station. Very clean, modern, and perfect for a short stay. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

Very good hotel , friendly and familiar people
The breakfast very good but i missed the normal cow milk , very big room with good bed at the 15 floor with an great view over paris , i wil come back very soon

Just spent four nights at Citizen M Gare de Lyon. Our whole experience was excellent, very modern and clean, central location, great food and drinks and last but not least the staff, the staff were all so friendly and accommodating, will definitely be back!!
Great Location!!! Just next to the Gare de Lyon Station. Most of furnitures in dining area and lounges are collection of VITRA. Must go bar in top floor to see the great view of paris before sunset.
WE LOVE BEN! Had the best customer experience. Loved the hotel room. Staff super friendly, nice rooftop bar. V relaxing.

Because of the strikes my train got canceled and i had to stay more nights than i planned on the hotel, i was stressed but kind Florian helped me make sure everything was taken care of. Thank you for everything.
Truly courteous and helpful staff. Very clean rooms. Convenient location. We were very happy to have stayed here.
Great customer service and the staffs are very helpful specially Andrew at the reception.very modern design and the view from the room was great.definitely will visit again.

For the price, it's very good
The hotel is very much catering to the hipster population however perfectly fine for a place to stay whilst checking out Paris
Location is good and staff are very friendly
Breakfast was decent
Great location. Great staff. Intelligent room. My 9yo daughter loved the room as much as me. Great stay... Thank you.
We spent three nights and it was a very nice experience. All the staff was very nice and the rooms very comfortable.
Great experience . Very different from a regular hotel. Small rooms but very cozy and quite affordable for the location.
very nice place. It has a nice place for smokers inside and at the same time the interior architecture is very nice .. you can eat more beautiful and cheap meals outside this location.

Excelente service and cozy rooms
Small but are compensated with the big and nice open areas and the restaurant
I've had a great experience at this hotel. Quite unique, rooms are full of IOT, everything can be controlled from the tablet.
Very modern. You can even stream your Netflix to the TV. Compact but very functional room.
Room a bit small but nice and clean. Location of hotel is very good, close to the metro and rer.
Super hotel, very comfy beds and very friendly staff! Recommended for both quick stays or cozy staycations!
Super easy checkin, modern and clean rooms, way better than staying in an old boomer hotel chain.
clean room, very good Wi-Fi, friendly staff, modern decoration, great location for train, metro and bus. A place I will recommend to friends
Great value, loved the techy, ultra-modern style without the crazy high-end price. Would definitely stay with citizenM again - in Paris and other destinations!
Nice rooms and I love the tablet that controls the entire room! Really close to Metro and it has an amazing shower!!!
very nice hotel the room was very nice and quiet  and it's smart hotel you control your room with an iPad and the stuff was lovely
Very cozy rooms, great personel and beautiful lounge, canteen, etc. couldn't recommend more for young couples :)
The best hotel I've ever been at, contemporary and modern. Absolute favorite, if you're going to any city in the world, check for a citizen M before any other option.
Really nice place...great staff, nice beds, loved the tech style approach...breakfast is really good too...definitely recommend this place
Cool and comfortable! :) Due to size of the room ideal for 2-3 nights, but it has all you need.
The place to meet and work in a calm environment......staff are really friendly and very efficient! Perfect meeting place for my international contacts.
Great rooms with  superb beds and showers, I'm now a fan of the CitizenM chain!!
Very trendy place, fabulous beds, very clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly.
Completely unconventional experience. Highly recommended. Once you stay here, you'll want to return every time you can
Modern and classy. Very good value for money. Next to Gare de Lyon, a plus for travellers.
Great hotel with a interesting use of technology to control lighting and climate control in the bathroom

Hoping to see you again soon.

reviews.text: Excelente ubicaciÃ³n y servicio, accesible a las lÃ­neas de metro, la vista impresionante al rÃ­o Senna, las zonas en comÃºn impecable, serÃ­a bueno que ofrezcan tours y tengan taxis accesibles

reviews.text: Fijn hotel met een ruime kamer en een goed bed. Ook de regendouche en het toilet waren fijn. De sfeerverlichting met behulp van de ipad was leuk. Wij hadden een upgrade voor een kamer met mooi uitzicht. Jammer dat de ramen zo vuil waren dat je er nauwelijks door kon kijken. Het leek alsof het de hele dag mistig was. Evengoed hebben we genoten van ons verblijf. De kamer was fijn en er was een heerlijk ontbijt. Bij een volgend bezoek komen we graag weer.
reviews.ownerResponse: A lovely hotel with a spacious room and a comfortable bed. The rain shower and toilet were also nice. The mood lighting, which was controlled via the iPad, was fun. I would have liked a kettle in the room, but otherwise, everything was nicely decorated, and it was a pleasant stay. The location is super convenient, just a stone's throw from Gare de Lyon. We were upgraded to a room with a beautiful view. It's a shame the windows were so dirty you could barely see out. It felt like it was foggy all day. Nevertheless, we enjoyed our stay. The room was nice, and there was a delicious breakfast. We'll be happy to return on our next visit.

reviews.ownerResponse:
We booked another hotel for two nights over New Year's Eve, which was a complete disaster, so we had to find a quick alternative and luckily we stumbled upon this Hotel CitizenM at Gare du Lyon.
The room (king-size double bed) and the hotel in general were excellent. There are many rooms available, so you can always book at short notice. The rooms are very modern and controlled via an iPad. There's a TV with many channels and features, the room has various adjustable lighting colors, and the bathroom with a rain shower is practically encased in frosted glass within the room. There's plenty of space and it's clean.
There's a restaurant on the first floor and a bar on the top floor. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is next to a metro, which takes you to the sights in just a few minutes.
Highly recommended.

The hotel is very modern and attractively located, just steps from the Gare de Lyon station, convenient for every metro line.
The hygiene aspect really surprised me: the room is impeccable, the shower and bathroom are absolutely perfect.
Technology is abundant: everything is controlled by an iPad, so you have complete home automation that allows you to adjust the light intensity and color, the room temperature, the blinds, and the TV (very large and located at the foot of the bed).
The space is a bit limited, but given the hotel's modest price, this is the best you can get. There's a convenient bar on the top floor where you can enjoy a delicious aperitif while gazing at the Seine. Excellent!

reviews.ownerResponse: A fantastic hotel next to Gare Lyon. The staff was very friendly from the beginning. The room I had was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. With a tablet you can control aspects such as television, heating or lights. About breakfast, great. It has quite a variety and quality. I will return to more hotels of this chain after this great experience.

It is convenient for transportation as it is directly connected to Lyon Station, a key transportation hub. You can move around without getting wet even in the rain, and you can do simple shopping inside the station. It's a short walk to the Seine River, so it's nice for a morning walk. At the entrance, a bowed checkered art welcomes you. You choose your room at the terminal at the entrance, but if there is one available, I think it's best to choose a room facing Rion Station. You can see the clock tower of Rion Station from the window in the morning and evening, and it's beautiful. The rooms are simple, but quiet and clean, with some cute little art. It is highly eco-friendly, so it is recommended for those who like such considerations.

Living proof that a chain hotel doesn't have to be boring!

I will definitely come back here when I'm in Paris!

reviews.ownerResponse: An incredible place, very well located, clean, comfortable, and with super friendly staff. A home-automated room with a very comfortable bed.

reviews.ownerResponse: I liked the hotel. Located 10 minutes walk from the Bastille Opera, the Seine embankment and Notre Dame de Paris are also within walking distance. View from the windows (if you are lucky) of the Eiffel Tower and other attractions. Modern and even futuristic decorated. The rooms are small but cozy, everything is controlled from an iPad, very cool. The breakfasts are excellent, scrambled eggs, cheeses, red fish, etc. I especially liked the mango and orange juices, as well as the croissants with jam. The Russian-speaking manager Ekaterina greeted us cordially and answered our questions.

reviews.text:
Ein Hotel welches nur zu empfehlen ist bei einer Parisreise. Es ist doch relativ Zentral gelegen und der Bahnhof ist direkt neben dran. Wir sind mal mit Uber und meistens mit der Bahn gÃ¼nstig bis zum Zentrum gefahren.
Man kann auch mal ein spaziergang machen und bis zum Notre Dame und noch weiter laufen. Wer mit dem Auto kommt kann dieses im Indigo Parkplatz nebendran sicher stehen lassen. Die Zimmer sind sehr sauber und modern. Es ist einfach nur zu empfehlen. Wer GlÃ¼ck hat kann von seinem Zimmer sogar den Eifelturm sehen.
reviews.ownerResponse:
A hotel that can only be recommended for a trip to Paris. It is relatively centrally located and the train station is right next to it. We sometimes took Uber and usually took the train to the center cheaply.
You can also take a walk and walk to Notre Dame and beyond. If you come by car you can leave it safely in the Indigo parking lot next door. The rooms are very clean and modern. It is simply recommended. If you're lucky, you can even see the Eiffel Tower from your room.

reviews.text: Il servizio Ã© eccellente, la camera piÃ¹ che futuristica. Tutto Ã© regolato da iPad : tende , TV, riscaldamento. Personale cordialissimo e zona abbastanza centrale. Evitate caffÃ¨ e dolci, niente di che per chi ha un palato italiano.
reviews.ownerResponse: The service is excellent, the room more than futuristic. Everything is regulated by iPad: curtains, TV, heating. Very friendly staff and quite central area. Avoid coffee and sweets, nothing special for those with an Italian palate.

reviews.text:
Hotel original de style ou il est trÃ¨s agrÃ©able de sÃ©journer.
Les chambres sont spacieuses et bien dÃ©corÃ©es.
Le bar sympa et les cocktails bons bien que la carte soit un peu restrictive sur les cocktails.
Les petits salons sont superbement bien agencÃ©s et la dÃ©co super.
L'emplacement parfait si vous arrivez gare de Lyon, car l'hÃ´tel se situe Ã  200 mÃ¨tres de la gare.
MÃ©tro juste au pied de l'hÃ´tel et accÃ¨s aux lignes principales.
Un Bon hotel
reviews.ownerResponse:
Original style hotel where it is very pleasant to stay.
The rooms are spacious and well decorated.
The nice bar and the cocktails are good although the menu is a little restrictive on cocktails.
The small lounges are superbly well arranged and the decor is great.
The perfect location if you arrive at Gare de Lyon, as the hotel is located 200 meters from the station.
Metro right outside the hotel and access to the main lines.
A good hotel

reviews.text:
Nous sommes arrivÃ©s au Citizen M en tout dÃ©but de matinÃ©e, pensant juste dÃ©poser notre sac Ã  la bagagerie avant de nous diriger vers le RER direction Disneyland, mais surprise, la chambre Ã©tait dÃ©jÃ  disponible ! Nous avons Ã©tÃ© chaleureusement accueillis par Mercy, qui nous a guidÃ© et indiquÃ© tout ce que nous devions savoir. Une chambre au 9e Ã©tage avec vue sur la Tour Eiffel, la Tour Montparnasse et le SacrÃ©-CÅur (je prÃ©cise que nous n'avions pas spÃ©cialement demandÃ© de vue mais ce fut agrÃ©able), une tablette Ã  disposition nous permet de contrÃ´ler la luminositÃ©, les stores/rideaux, la climatisation et la tÃ©lÃ©vision, pour le plus grand bonheur de mon fils de 10 ans !
AprÃ¨s une journÃ©e fatigante, nous avons passÃ© une trÃ¨s bonne nuit, sans bruit. Petit dÃ©jeuner trÃ¨s copieux, check-out trÃ¨s rapide et toujours accompagnÃ© d'une hÃ´tesse d'accueil devant les PC au cas oÃ¹. Nous recommandons vivement cet hÃ´tel !
reviews.ownerResponse:
We arrived at Citizen M very early in the morning, thinking of just dropping off our bag in the luggage room before heading to the RER towards Disneyland, but surprise, the room was already available! We were warmly welcomed by Mercy, who guided us and told us everything we needed to know. A room on the 9th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower, the Montparnasse Tower and the SacrÃ©-CÅur (I should point out that we did not specifically request a view but it was pleasant), a tablet available allows us to control the lighting, the blinds/curtains, the air conditioning and the television, to the delight of my 10 year old son!
After a tiring day, we had a very good night, without noise. Very generous breakfast, very quick check-out and always accompanied by a hostess in front of the PCs just in case. We highly recommend this hotel!

reviews.text: Das Check in und Check out war extrem schnell und benÃ¶tigt kein Personal. Das Personal ist aber trotzdem sehr hilfsbereit und sehr freundlich. Die Bar im 16. Stock mit Aussicht auf die Stadt Paris ist super und sehr empfehlenswert.
reviews.ownerResponse: Check-in and check-out were extremely quick and didn't require any staff. However, the staff was still very helpful and friendly. The bar on the 16th floor with a view of Paris is fantastic and highly recommended.

reviews.text:
HÃ´tel  futuriste ou plutÃ´t ultra moderne. Notre chambre Ã©tait vraiment parfaite. Tout est gÃ©rÃ© avec une tablette, l'Ã©clairage la tÃ©lÃ© la clim etc...

Super bar resto (non stop)  Mac Ã  disposition etc...

reviews.ownerResponse:
Futuristic or rather ultra modern hotel. Our room was truly perfect. Everything is managed with a tablet, lighting, TV, air conditioning, etc.
Even though everything is connected there are lots of super friendly staff who speak all languages.
Super bar restaurant (non-stop) Mac available etc...
I recommend

reviews.text: PedÃ­ una habitaciÃ³n con vistas al Sena y nos dieron la habitaciÃ³n 401, nos encantÃ³ muy amplia y luminosa.El hotel es muy moderno estÃ¡ muy buen ubicado y esta muy bien comunicado a tan solo 200 metros tienes la estaciÃ³n. Quiero agradecer en especial a Monserrat e Isabel su trato y atenciÃ³n en espaÃ±ol, el resto no te dan ni los buenos dÃ­as si no lo dices en inglÃ©s o francÃ©s.
reviews.ownerResponse: I asked for a room with views of the Seine and they gave us room 401, we loved it, it was very spacious and bright. The hotel is very modern, very well located and very well connected, just 200 meters from the station. I especially want to thank Monserrat and Isabel for their treatment and attention in Spanish, the rest don't even say good morning if you don't say it in English or French.

reviews.text:
Ambiance trÃ¨s agrÃ©able dans cet hÃ´tel moderne et chaleureux. Bon cocktail en rooftop avec vue sur Paris et la tour Eiffel illuminÃ©e. Personnel trÃ¨s sympa aussi !
Chambre petite mais fonctionnelle, moderne et propre avec bonne literie et bonne douche. Dommage que ma n'ai pas Ã©tÃ© faite...dÃ©ception en rentrant ce soir...
reviews.ownerResponse:
Very pleasant atmosphere in this modern and welcoming hotel. Good cocktails on the rooftop with a view of Paris and the illuminated Eiffel Tower. Very friendly staff too!
Small but functional, modern and clean room with comfortable bedding and a good shower. Too bad my room wasn't cleaned...disappointed when I got back tonight...

reviews.text:
TrÃ¨s bel hÃ´tel ! Rien a dire, le personnel est trÃ¨s sympa et de trÃ¨s bon cocktail.
SupplÃ©ment pour la chambre avec une trÃ¨s belle vue, on a eu la chance dâavoir une grande chambre pour la semaine !
Je recommande.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Very nice hotel! Nothing to say, the staff is very friendly and the cocktails are very good.
Supplement for the room with a very nice view, we were lucky to have a large room for the week!
I recommend.

reviews.text: AuÃergewÃ¶hnliches Hotel mit einem auÃergewÃ¶hnlichen Team. Die Zimmer sind zwar klein, aber sehr funktional und ziemlich smart. GerÃ¤umige Nasszelle mit Toilette, riesiges und bequemes Bett. Sauber und gepflegtes Haus. Das Team ist jung, gut ausgebildet und arbeitet sehr kundenorientiert. Auch fÃ¼r ein unerwartetes Problem beim Check-In, wurde eine LÃ¶sung gefunden. FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck sollte man sich gÃ¶nnen, auÃer man frÃ¼hstÃ¼ckt selbst nicht oder weiÃ genau wo er in Paris einkehren kann. Und sollte das Wetter nicht mitspielen, lÃ¤d die WohnzimmeratmosphÃ¤re zum chillen ein. Die Lage des Hotels ist ideal! Zwei BahnhÃ¶fe liegen in unmittelbarer NÃ¤he und erleichtern die Pariserkundung. Danke allen, fÃ¼r eine schÃ¶ne Zeit.
reviews.ownerResponse: An exceptional hotel with an exceptional team. The rooms may be small, but they are very functional and quite smart. They have a spacious bathroom with a toilet, and a huge, comfortable bed. The hotel is clean and well-maintained. The team is young, well-trained, and very customer-focused. They even found a solution for an unexpected problem at check-in. You should treat yourself to breakfast, unless you don't eat breakfast yourself or know exactly where to eat in Paris. And if the weather isn't great, the living room atmosphere invites you to relax. The hotel's location is ideal! Two train stations are nearby, making exploring Paris easy. Thank you all for a wonderful time.

reviews.ownerResponse:
Awesome hotel! The service is great. The rooms are not for families with children, but if you are traveling alone or as a couple, this is an ideal option. It has been said by everyone who can, but control from an iPad is an extremely comfortable thing :) (but itâs better to additionally set an alarm clock on your phone; it didnât work for us!)

The breakfasts are pleasant, special thanks for the luxurious coffee, the softest croissants and freshly squeezed orange juice.

Everyone understands you in English without any problems, is very friendly and will help you at any time of the day or night (we needed a second blanket at one in the morning, for example). We were here for 4 nights, probably covered all the shifts at the reception and restaurant, it was very pleasant to communicate with each of the staff!

In Charles de Gaules it was a little more convenient for them, because there was the opportunity to buy dinner there, but this is not critical - there is everything around, from good French restaurants to Turkish duners.

I wonât talk about the location, everything can be seen on the map ;)
Almost everything is very easy to get to on foot or by metro.

reviews.text:
Es un hotel diferente a todo lo que anteriormente se conoce como hotel. Todo en las habitaciones estÃ¡ automatizado y controlado a travÃ©s de un iPad.  Luces, cortinas, tele, a/a.. las habitaciones si que es verdad que son pequeÃ±as pero dispones en ellas de todo lo que te hace falta. El desayuno estÃ¡ muy bien. No es muy completo pero tiene cosas ricas y NO SOLO SE PUEDE TOMAR UN CAFE como antes he leÃ­do. El Ã¡tico es como especie de pub con mÃºsica y vistas que es chulo.
Todo decorado muy moderno y muy colorido.
El personal es encantador y hacen todo lo posible por complacerte y entenderte. Sobre todo el chico rubio con barba y moÃ±ito y tambiÃ©n el chico Moreno que habla espaÃ±ol perfectamente. A estos dos seÃ±ores se les deveria de subir el sueldo!.
reviews.ownerResponse:
It's a hotel unlike anything previously known as a hotel. Everything in the rooms is automated and controlled via an iPad. Lights, curtains, TV, air conditioning... the rooms are certainly small, but they have everything you need. The breakfast is very good. It's not very comprehensive, but it has delicious items, and you CAN'T JUST GET A COFFEE, as I've read before. The attic is like a kind of pub with music and views, which is cool.
Everything is very modern and colorfully decorated.
The staff is charming and does everything possible to please and understand you. Especially the blond guy with a beard and a bun, and also the dark-haired guy who speaks Spanish perfectly. These two gentlemen should get a raise!

reviews.ownerResponse: This hotel is one of my favorite hotels in Paris. It has the style of young people. Both the feel of the lobby and the smart controls in the room are good. The price is not high compared to many surrounding hotels, and the location is very good. The train station is five minutes away. If you go to Notre Dame from here, it only takes more than ten minutes. But last time we went, the weather was a bit weird, September, but all kinds of windy and howling. Overall good.

reviews.text: Superbe hÃ´tel, trÃ¨s design, en excellent Ã©tat. TrÃ¨s bien insonorisÃ©. Vue sympa sur Paris. Bonne sÃ©lection de films. Les salles communes au 1er Ã©tage sont vraiment trÃ¨s agrÃ©ables et chaleureuses. Un havre de paix en plein Paris, Ã  5min Ã  pied dâune bouche de mÃ©tro et de la Gare de Lyon.
reviews.ownerResponse: Superb hotel, very designer, in excellent condition. Very well soundproofed. Nice view of Paris. Good selection of films. The common rooms on the 1st floor are really very pleasant and warm. A haven of peace in the heart of Paris, a 5-minute walk from a metro station and the Gare de Lyon.

reviews.text:
Le lieu est beau et design, propre, l'accueil est excellent. Je recommande le lieu.
Tout est commandable via l'IPad ou depuis son smartphone Ã  partir de l'application CitizenM. TrÃ¨s pratique.
Seuls bÃ©mols Ã  savoir, la chambre est un peu Ã©troite et peu pratique pour deux personnes et l'Ã©vier est dans la chambre et non dans la salle de bain...
Pour le reste, tout est confortable et l'environnement est agrÃ©able.
reviews.ownerResponse:
The place is beautiful and stylish, clean, and the welcome is excellent. I recommend it.
Everything can be controlled via iPad or smartphone using the CitizenM app. Very convenient.
The only drawbacks are that the room is a bit narrow and impractical for two people, and the sink is in the bedroom, not the bathroom.
Otherwise, everything is comfortable and the environment is pleasant.

On se sent trÃ¨s bien. La vue de ma chambre Ã©tait sublime. La propretÃ© rien Ã  dire, impeccable. LâexpÃ©rience est excellente Ã  tout les points de vue. Je recommande cet hÃ´tel.

The view from my room was sublime. The cleanliness, nothing to say, impeccable. The experience is excellent from every point of view. I recommend this hotel.

Le coin salle de bain est design sans qu'on s'y sente Ã  l'Ã©troit.

reviews.ownerResponse:
Nothing to complain about; the centralized control of the TV, lighting, and curtains on an iPad is quite fun and practical!

reviews.ownerResponse: The most modern hotel I've ever been to: self-check-in on PCs located at reception. In the room, you have an iPad with which you control everything: the lights, their color, intensity, and switching on, the person, the air conditioning, and syncing with your Apple content so you can play it on the TV (I don't know how it works; I'm an Android user). Spaceship-style decor, small but adequate rooms, and a large, comfortable bed. The bathroom looks like a spacious shower cubicle. They offer free water. The Wi-Fi works well. The rest of the hotel is also very modern and has a great atmosphere, full of cool people. Breakfast is extra. It's next to Gare de Lyon, so getting to the main tourist attractions by metro is very easy. Highly recommended.

reviews.text: CitizenM Paris Gare de Lyon offers much of what I have come to appreciate about the brand: thoughtful design, genuinely friendly service, and clever use of space. My stay here delivered a strong overall experience with some standout highlights, though it did not begin without its hiccups.||||Booking Experience: Appreciated Transparency After Pricing Drop||||As someone who works in the travel industry, I am fully aware of dynamic pricing strategies. Still, I was surprised when the nightly rate for my room dropped dramatically on the day of arrival by more than would usually be expected even for a last minute rate shift. It admittedly left a bit of a sour taste, especially after booking well in advance.||||To their credit, the hotel team handled it brilliantly. Upon arrival, the staff and the on duty manager graciously allowed me to cancel and rebook the same room on the spot at the new lower rate. Their flexibility and professionalism turned what could have been a frustrating moment into a positive one, and I am very grateful for their help.||||Room and View: Cozy with a Parisian Postcard Backdrop||||My room followed the typical citizenM template: compact, efficient, and tech forward, with all controls accessible via a tablet or the mobile app. The oversized bed was just as comfortable as I have come to expect, and everything was immaculate.||||What made this stay especially memorable was the view. I had a picture perfect window overlooking the Paris skyline, with the Eiffel Tower sparkling in the distance each night. It was a small luxury that added a real sense of place and made the stay feel special.||||On this trip, we were also celebrating my partnerâs birthday, and the hotel surprised us with a thoughtful handwritten card. That personal touch was very much appreciated and speaks volumes about the care and attention the staff provide.||||Facilities and Public Spaces: Stylish and Well Kept||||Unlike some of the older citizenM locations, this property still feels fresh and well maintained. The design throughout the public spaces was sleek and vibrant with the kind of atmosphere that encourages both solo relaxation and social interaction. Everything felt clean, well kept, and in working order.||||The rooftop bar was a lovely surprise: stylish and offering panoramic views across Paris. While fully enclosed so do not expect a terrace, it is still a great space to enjoy a drink and soak in the skyline. The ambience leans more quiet lounge than buzzing cocktail bar, which suited me just fine.||||Service: Truly a Standout||||As always with citizenM, the staff or âambassadorsâ were one of the best parts of the experience. Warm, engaging, and genuinely helpful, they managed to make every interaction feel personal without ever being intrusive. Whether helping me rebook at check in or offering advice on the local area, their hospitality was top notch.||||Location: Excellent Connections but a Bit Gritty After Dark||||The hotelâs location right next to Gare de Lyon is ideal for travelers arriving by train or wanting quick access to the metro. From here, it is incredibly easy to get to just about anywhere in the city. That said, the surrounding area, while busy and practical by day, can feel a bit rough around the edges at night. It is worth being mindful if you are returning late.||||Final Thoughts: Great Stay with a Strong Recovery||||CitizenM Paris Gare de Lyon delivered exactly the kind of experience I associate with the brand: comfortable, efficient, and warm, all in a stylish package. While the dynamic pricing stumble at the beginning threw me off, the way the staff handled it turned things around completely. Combined with a memorable view, friendly service, and a well kept property, the stay turned out to be a highlight.||||If you are a fan of the citizenM experience or simply looking for a well located modern hotel with excellent transport links and a human touch, this property is absolutely worth considering. I will happily return, especially for that Eiffel Tower view.

Great location. Right beside Gare de Lyon and not far from Gare/Paris de Austerlitz. Room is modern, bed is very comfortable. Really love they use the pad to control everything. Nice and thoughtful light and night light options. Rain shower is good. Room is a bit small, but good size for single or couples. But it's small for more than 2. Staffs are very friendly. I recommend this hotel
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello Vivian,
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your experience!
We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the comfortable bed, easy-to-use tech and our friendly team of ambassadors. Yes, our rooms are on the smaller size as they are intended for two guests max! But they contain everything you need for a relaxing and enjoyable stay. 
We thank you kindly for your recommendation and hope to welcome you again!
Take care,
citizen Madelaine

reviews.text: looked different from pictures,â¦ estate is on the slightly older side and rooms are not as sizeable as imagined. lifts are tough to operate, requires holding the door open before you can step in, and itâs really cramped too (2 pax + 2 luggages). to get to the lift there is a small flight of stairs. room doors are light and not too sound proof. however, hotel is good location from major train station Lyon perrache where you can select if coming in from paris.

The hotel is in a great location. Rooms are very comfortable and spacious.  Good night sleep on the bed.  Staff is very friendly and the breakfast is decent.  Some amenities such as an elevator were sometimes out of order.

The layout of the bed is landscape and could not straighten my legs have to shift. The room is controlled by smart system. You just need to use iPad to control air conditioning and lights and even night mode

Love the hotel. Loved the idea to use the iPad to control the room! Also loved the option to skip room cleaning and give a CitizenM give a â¬3 donation instead! Really good initiative.

Would have been 5* but the iron on floor 10 was broken, I spent 10 mins waiting for it to warm up, informed staff who seemed to know about it (but no out of order sign (staff sent me to floor 4 to use there instead but it was also not very hot. I had to go to the office looking like I donât know how to iron a shirt :(

Should be a quick and easy fix!
reviews.ownerResponse:
We are pleased to hear that you appreciated our tech-savvy amenities and the eco-friendly initiative that is the citizenMovement. However, we regret the inconvenience you faced with the ironing rooms. Though we can't change your past experience, we aim to ensure our amenities are in top shape for a perfect stay in the future. Your feedback is noted and we will look into this promptly.

CitizenChristian

reviews.text: We are returning guests. We liked it more before because there are a lot of construction work around. New buildings popping up around, closing the view. Inside everything is like before, clean and OK.||

Great location for Garre du Lyon. Very helpful staff that can speak lots of languages.

Standard type rooms for a CitizenM. The tablet room control can be a bit of a pain.

There is a bar on the 16th floor.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello Paul,
Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your experience! Your comments are helpful to us as they teach us a lot about our guests and how we can be doing better. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our great location by the Gare de Lyon and our friendly multi-lingual team! We are sorry to hear that you encountered some issues with the tablet- we aim to ensure the in-room tablet makes the guest experience as smooth as possible, and we apologize if that was not your experience. 
We hope that you will come and see us again one day!
Take care,
citizen Madelaine

reviews.text: Not the best CitizenM that I have stayed at, but still good! Made a last minute reservation in November and was able to check in same day. The room was a little beat up, had to move because the sink wasnât draining. The building is also a bit odd because it is a converted office building. Windows are small but have a nice view.

Citizen M located next to Paris Gare de Lyon station making movements within Paris so much easier. The hotel staff made the check-in process so easy and took advantage at minimal cost to upgrade to a higher floor with view of the station. Room was clean and use of technology to control light and TV more fun.

Loved the hotel, room spacious. Wished to have bedside tables or a shelf both sides as we both wear glasses. Staff so friendly and helpful. Right next to the train station. Easy to get around. Not too far to walk to food places. You can see the Eiffel tower from the 16th floor bar. Breakfast was a bit expensive for what it was. You can get free filtered water from the bar to take to your room or top up your bottle. They have nice lounge areas.

This was our second stay at this location. This time we had a total of 3 rooms.  The hotel is conveniently located and within walking distance of several restaurants. The majority of the staff were very helpful. The restaurant and bar were both outstanding.
The only opportunity was the rooms. We booked higher floor rooms with views of the Eiffel Tower, which all three had. One of our rooms was handicap accessible for my mother, which worked out great. Surprisingly, the other room, which was next door, was also roomier. Our third room was on another floor and was a standard size. When we went downstairs to see if any other corner rooms were available (was willing to pay for upgrade), the lady at the front desk explained that all of the rooms were the same size and only the layout is different. There was a clear difference in the sizes. We can understand if she'd taken the approach that no other corner rooms were available, but it was sorta insulting to insist that all of the rooms are the exact same size.

This hotel was great for what we needed (which was a clean, comfortable, conveniently located place while we explore the city all day). Itâs kind of like a private room in a nice hostel. The location was so convenient, close to train stations and the Seine. Lots of cafes nearby. Check in is super easy and efficient, and the staff were extremely friendly. The room itself is pocket-sized but has everything you need. The bed is super cozy and blackout curtains make it a great place to recoup after travelling. The room has a small fridge (like, very small) and nice bath products. Make sure whoever you travel with to this hotel you are super comfortable with as the bathroom is a glass box. As another reviewer mentioned, if you have large luggage this room would be a challenge. The lobby bar is great - we went for breakfast each day (not the buffet, you could go and get a croissant or pain au chocolat and proper espresso machine coffee for under 5â¬). Itâs a really great space (for breakfast and a drink). The food menu for later in the day is strange - we thought we would go one night but ended up elsewhere instead. The rooftop bar is really cool and you can see the Eiffel Tower, very cool at night. Overall Iâd stay here again for the great service, clean room, convenient location and price was decent.

Very small room (not unusual I understand for Paris) but important to note if you are traveling with full suitcases there is basically no room for them. Rooms clean, bed and pillows comfortable.  Nice and helpful staff. Great location near the river. Close to Gare De Lyon station making train and metro and bus nearby. Tiny bathroom clearly inserted into room no vent. Nice rain shower head. Our view from window in photo.

This hotel is located at walking distance from Gare de Lyon railway station. The rooms are average in size and compactly arranged. All the basic amenities are present in the room. This hotel offers self check in and check out. The hospitality of the staff is the best part of this hotel. It also has restaurant and working area within the premises.

with the price and the location, i'm fine with the level of hygiene (some dust in the room, poor air quality which made my nose running but we'll let it slide) and facilities for the room (tech-enabled), bars and restaurants residing in the hotel.
Staff were friendly. mostly an automated checkin process. close to the station, but still not easy to nagivate if you have lots of luggage, its close but not that close.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello citizen Chan!

I'm thrilled to hear that you found our staff to be friendly during your stay with us. It's always fantastic to hear that our team members are making a positive impact.

Regarding the checkin process, we've aimed to streamline it for convenience and efficiency. We understand that, while being close to the station, navigating with a lot of luggage can be a challenge. Your insights are valuable and we appreciate you sharing them.

We hope that, despite this, you enjoyed your time at our hotel and look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Best wishes.

Madelaine

reviews.text: The rooms are small with little extra space to move around, but the location is excellent, being close to public transport. Cristina and the team were fantastic, and we received outstanding service and support from the staff overall.

Our stay was pleasant and location was ideal as we had metro lines in walkable distance  and we had easy access to all popular places. Rooms very small,  okay for two people as we stayed out most of the time.

Very conveniently located near Gare de Lyon for SNCF or the Paris Subway. Less than 100 yards to the Seine and views of the Eiffel Tower from many rooms.
Rooms are somewhat smaller than the average American hotel room but have most of the same amenities. Our room had no drawers for storage so living out of two suitcases on a long trip was a bit awkward. One interesting feature is the iPad by the bed. It controls everything from the TV to day curtains, night shades, lights, mood lighting and housekeeping requests.
The bar and dining areas can best be described as eclectic. Staff are multi national and I was quite surprised to have a Chinese Australian greeting me in French at the bar.

No kettle in room and no galley/kitchen on floor, had to go down to reception for hot water
Only a few channels on the tv, everything relies on streaming, poor controls
No usb ports

Superb staff with delegated authority
Clean and comfy bed
Excellent shower and toiletries
Not luxurious but a nice space if you are on the go! Great central location in Gare del Lyon.

When I'm travelling for shoots I usually stay in CitizenM. They're solid quality for how reasonably priced they are, comfortable and clean. The rooms are tiny but for solo travel it's not an issue and I find them cosy. They have the basic amenities I need (hair dryer, mini fridge, canteen and bar) and the beds are comfy.
This one had a couple issues- the tv didn't work and the air-conditioning rattled all night, but aside from that, I had a good stay and always use them for my city breaks.
The Gard du Nord one is well located, right on the river with beautiful views and a lot within walking distance.

Pros: The room is small but practical, the rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable, the breakfast is very good, the croissants are excellent, the luggage drop service is very good, the staff are very helpful, good location.
Cons: the windows are very small and the view is facing the other buildings, the room is suffocating, it would be nice to open the windows, the air conditioner is automatic and cannot be turned off, it gets cold inside, airless.
Had some issues with the heating in my room(s), but overall the hotel is great âÂ modern and techie, the staff is very helpful so it's a great experience.

We stayed for 3 days here. We took the breakfast also and it was good. Lot of options. Location was very nice as it was easier to leave to any place. The train station and bus stop was very near.
Also the staff was very polite and helpful. The roof top restaurant we watched the Eiffel tower at night also. It was beautiful and overall stay was quiet comfortable.

First experience at CitizenM, and not the last. I understand and partially agree with some of the other reviewerâs challenges with this hotel (bed size/arrangement, room ipad, check-in). However, if you understand what youâre signing up for it can be a great experience and value.

We stayed for 5 nights. The room was super quiet and well insulated from sound. Making the room pitch black with the touch of the ipad button was great for getting over jet lag. The bed was immensely comfortable, and the temperature controls were perfect. There were some minor maintenance issues with the room (-1/2 star), but it was clean and the CitizenM room design was well thought out, however it would have been nice to have two luggage drawers under the bed. The ipad is somewhat cumbersome at times, but it include a lot of nice features, and even recommendations for the city which we enjoyed (especially the Lavomatic bar). I also wasnât a huge fan of the need to schedule cleaning, as I forgot one day and inadvertently missed out, and the ironing room on our floor did not have working lights (-1/2 star).

We didnât have breakfast, but the 16th floor bar was a wonderful refuge, and both bartenders were fantastic. I particularly enjoyed the Hennessy XO for only â¬10 and the giant Affligem beers. All staff members were polite, however it seems that most people actually need help with the self-check in process.

The location of the hotel is somewhat away from the main drag if youâre a tourist, but the convenient access to Gare Lyon and Gare Austerlitz across the river was definitely nice, as were the adjacent river bars like Barapapa. Overall would stay here again.

Spent a long weekend with 3 nights in the hotel. Room was large and clean with an amazingly comfortable bed. Staff were extremely friendly. I really liked the aerial view of Paris on the carpet. Good view of the Paris skyline from the lounge bar on the top floor. We didn't spend much time there since we were too busy watching the freely available films :-)

For the very reasonable price, the room is acceptable. Too tech oriented that it was inconvenient and annoying. Cute room but bed aligned to window makes 2nd person sleeping along it very difficult to get out. For the non-nimble, will not work. Overall very cute hotel with many nooks in the lobby and breakfast room. If gare de lyon is not your main interest, no reason to stay here other than price.

Very modern hotel. Very.
Controls on the rooms features (lights, blinds, TV, etc) are through an iPad.
Bars and restaurants are very sleek and serve decent food and breakfast. Top floor bar has great views. Bed is comfy.
A cool version of the traditional uberfunctional French hotel.

Easy check-in with QR code. Room cozy but reasonably well organized; nice shower. Staff quite amiable. Breakfast was good, perhaps not quite worth 15â¬. AC non functioning on arrival, staff apologetic but without alternatives (no fans or opening windows). Another minor malfunction was reported but it was several hours before maintenance appeared (and I was sleeping so did not get fixed). Beds were quite comfortable and we had a nice peek-a-boo view of the Eiffel tower!

Modern designed hotel. Even size is not big, but space is used efficiently. It's fairly comfortable considering average French hotels are small.  Breakfast is very good,  lots of selections,  and good quality. Location is good, not far to any tourism hot spots.

Lovely and friendly staff, rooms very clean, just a bit too small. Location is great and generally it was a good experience. Mercy, Jasmine and Emilia were so lovely. A good place to stay if you donât have a lot of luggage ð

It's a fresh and cosy hotel.
The rooms are of ferry cabin size but very clean and with a comfy bed. The high tech smart home system is well integrated. It's very small but of high standard.
The big plus with this hotel is the penthouse bar with excellent staff and great views

Lovely hotel, perfectly located if you are travelling from Gare de Lyon train station.  Rooms are perfect size for a short stay and staff is super friendly. Cool that we can control so much of the room from the tablet. 4 stars only because the room was not super clean with lots of dust and hairs from previous guests. I would still stay here again though.

First, let me say, this was one of the best, modern, and clean hotels Iâve visited. When I arrived, it was raining and unfortunately, I got soaked in the rain upon walking from the train station to the hotel. Even though itâs not a long walk, the train was coming down hard and I was soaked, and so was my suitcase. The attendant luckily saw this and allowed me to check in almost 4 hours before check-in time. So thankful for this! After a long flight from America, and being caught in the rain, the last thing I wanted to do was walk around Paris soaked.

The fridge is stocked with 2 bottles of water every day. The location is also good as it is near the metro, many restaurants, bakeries, and shops. There is also a nice lounge on the main floor, and an even better lounge on the top floor with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower. All the rooms are also non-smoking which is a plus for a non smoker like me. I really really enjoyed that the room was controlled with an iPad. You can control the lights, TV, blinds, and play movies and music that connected to the TV! After a long day of sightseeing, it was a nice highlight to come to a room with American movies and to wind down. Another plus was the bed. It was so big and super comfortable!

The only downside was yes the room was clean, but had a faint smell. Nothing foul but defiantly had a stench that could have been flushed out with a window being opened but the windows are locked.

Also, the attendant reserved a taxi for me and said that it was a flat rate of â¬32 to Orly. When I got to the airport, the driver charged me â¬45!!!!!! The driver said there was a reservation fee of â¬7 plus something else he mumbled. He spoke English perfectly fine up until I asked him about the fare then he âdidnât know how to say it in English.â Really? I believe the reservation part but how do you account for the rest that was charged? The staff member at the hotel should have told me this. I asked him twice, on two different occasions and both times he told me â¬32 flat. It would have been nice for him to be honest with me. That way I could make a better informed decision about my other options.

All in all, it was a good stay and I would stay again. I would  just be aware. After all, you are probably a tourist and their bottom line is to get us to spend more money.

Really comfortable hotel! It has the feeling of a luxurious hostel with its living room style lounges. Even the bar at the top floor feels like a living room. The rooms are comfortable, not big but they have everything you might need!

Great hotel chain, but man the kitchen could use a bit of improvement! I told my husband that I like airplane food more... But enough of the negative, because there are tons of positives. The hotel is visually appealing and super comfy. The rooms are tiny but super modern. You don't feel squished, in fact you feel quite comfortable. The beds are great. I usually have a hard time sleeping away from home, but I slept more than 10 hours in the comfy bed!

Not the best location, you are removed from all the attractions. Fantastic service... The living room area is amazing and well decorated. The breakfast is great and worth the money. Bed is amazing and the smart room features are nifty. The shower toilet situation is awful. Unless you are intimate with whoever you are staying with, you will be visiting the public bathroom.

Modern hotels with great amenities. Like their breakfast (extra cost). This location also has a bar at top floor (not roof-top). The room is a bit smaller than we thought, but the location is very convenient.

Also using iPad to control is a great idea, but the user experience of the software is not so good.

Really nice hotel! Good location. Very high tech room! If you are in the mood you can even take a shower with adjustable disco lights! I stayed in a room at the tenth floor. I had a really nice view over the city! To sum up, I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Fantastic modern hotel with well thought out details. Room was cozy but cute. Enjoyed free movie selection. Only feedback would be: add conditioner to the bathroom toiletries, the alarm system was annoying, late check out by an extra hour was quite difficult to arrange (front desk didn't call me back until it was the original checkout time).

Always a fan of CitizenMâs - everything you need in a city hotel: exceptionally comfortable beds, great social spaces in central locations and a good use of technology.

That said, the rooms here could do with a bit more love as theyâre starting to show a bit of wear and tear, and our bathroom door didnât completely shut - not ideal in a small space.

If you donât need to be near Gare du Lyon, Iâd definitely try one of the other locations in the city instead.

Summary: Centrally located hotel with great transport connections. Fantastic staff. Innovative rooms that are very comfortable. Breakfast is tasty but limited, other food and drink ordered can be pricey. Would love to stay here again!

Getting there: Pretty easy to locate, right next to Paris Gare de Lyon (who would have guessed?) which has many different RER and metro lines.

The hotel: Fantastic, friendly staff that even managed to move our room for a better view when requested at check in (View from room enclosed). Rooms are a good size, perfect for couples. Very large bed with rain shower! Everything in the room is controlled with an iPad, making room use very simple. Free movies are not yet included in rooms because of the hotel recently opening. Breakfast was included for our time every morning and was tasty but selection of food is limited. Other food and drink ordered outside breakfast can be pricey.

Small chic rooms with just what you need, and not much room for anything else! Super comfy bedding, and amazing sound proofing make for a great night's sleep. One little issue is the 'tech' is a bit buggy , with lights randomly turning on and the 'gentle' wake up being the exact opposite of!

Stayed here for 6 days and here are my findings.  Breakfast is great however a little overpriced. Would have liked to see coffee or tea in the room for customers to make however the only things you will find is water. Limited TV channels in English however the staff both at the downstairs and upstairs bars along with the staff that checked us in and out were very helpful. Very close to RER.

Great hotel, it is clean , and staff are very helpful and attentive. My only two comments are, a coffee pot in the room would be a nice addition and also location was a bit far from the centre, however it is very close to metro station overall I had a good experience

Lovely stay at CitizenM, although I would have appreciated a bigger room. The staff was really helpful and gave us great tips for our first stay in the city. There were not a lot of vegan options for breakfast but Yoli did understood our concerns and Lucie gave us some advice on vegan restaurants in the area that exceeded our expections. Also big shoutout to Isabel, her Disney expertise helped us have a magical day at the parks.

Overall a very nice experience and great staff!

P.S., Wanna know why they call Paris the City of Lights? Check their rooftop!

The Hotel itself was a new experience for me, new technologies applied for everything including self check-in check-out ,controlling lights ,and curtains through ipad, but I cannot make my evaluation based on this , as it is not the main issue for me.
here are positive points:
1. the location was very good at least for me since I planned to travel to Geneva from Gare de lyon , the hotel is very near to gare de lyon.
2. The lobby is amazing and has very nice decoration.
3. the rooms are clean and the bath is good as well.
4. Good wifi.
5. The view was amazing through the window.
6. The rooms were soundproof.
7. We forget some stuffs in the lobby and the staff bringed them to our room once they found it.
Negative points:
1. Small rooms.
2. I just didn't like the sink to be inside the rooms instead of the bath.
3. The bed was too high and directly touch the wall which was not nice.
4. Non-availability of tea/coffee facilities.

Great location, just in front of The station. Easy access in and out. Automatic check in system is cool. Well equipped boutique hotel. However i found bunch of dust on the bed, and basin stuck. And TV doesnât work well.

Nice efficient hotel in Paris

Bar:
Nice view from the top. Nice to rest and have a bit of Champagne while looking at the eiffel tower.

Rooms:
Small but, I guess that it's why it's efficient

Breakfasts:
Really good! Love France for their good breakfasts!

Kind of strange hotel but I think I like it:

There I classic reception more a guided self service terminal. Staff is English speaking and friendly.

I wouldnât recommend to go for the breakfast. Itâs way to little for the price of 17â¬.

The room size is ok as youâre not in for long and I liked all the âsmart homeâ connectivity.

BUT a real minus: light in the bathroom is only manageable via the iPad. The iPad has no option to turn off the screen. Means the whole night the screen in on or you put it up side down and the next morning the battery is empty. You can imagine no light in the bathroom ;)
We just asked for our way, and the lady was nice with us.

First things first : you canÂ´t go bad with citizenm hotels. Fun, well apointed rooms, cozy vibes, often some good rooftop bars and friendly people ð The reason i gave this one 4 stars is because the staff, altough they are friendly , come over as they are bored. I understand it is low season, but every time i went to the canteen or so they were sometimes more staff then people, gathering around and more talking to eachother and sitting on tables then focussing on the guests which is a shame and a bumper on the vibe in the room :) Keep the energetic vibes !
They were correct about everything! No lies! The location was fantastic and it was a brand new hotel with modern technology! Even though room was very tiny bit of had everything hung you needed!

Small rooms (to be expected in Paris), with super comfortable king size bed.... Utilizes technology to make it a great experience - iPad controls tv, lights, air conditioning, blinds, etc.... Staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is a 3 minute walk to the Gare de Lyon station (which will take you pretty much anywhere you'd need to go).

The area is not to my usual taste but it is close to Gare de Lyon which is a big metro and itâs only 20min walk to Marais district.  The hotel itself is the usual tech and friendly standard of CitizenM. Very roomy bed in an otherwise compact but well designed room good for two people, preferably couples.  Best things was CloudM the rooftop bar overlooking Paris.

A well located hotel in Paris next to Gare de Lyon. The staff are very friendly and speak many languages. The room is a bit small but the space is very well used and it is all with smart technology. Recommended

Our third time staying at the Paris C.M hotel.  Within walking distance of Gare de Lyon, local buses directly outside also, plentiful cafe bars snd restaurants.   The area is within Paris 11/12th District.  A chilled boho vibe when walking through the streets.
C.M has a great bar restaurant in main entrance serving fresh breakfast, lunches, light, tasty teatime meals. A good choice for vegetarian eatersð.
TWO friendly suggestions: I forgot to bring mine and missed BODY LOTION.  And, a suggestion for the restaurant: A quality dual-gauged Juicing machine for on-the-spot juiced organic veggies and fruit?ð¤

We always use CitizenM when staying in London.
This one was still great, but the welcome wasnât as warm as we were used to, and we didnât realise that room cleaning had to be requested until it was too late - so we were low on towels and toilet roll.
Food & drink is expensive - and the bartender on floor 16 seemed offended that we only had the one drink.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Dear citizen Jake,
We are sorry to hear that the welcome was not as warm as in our London hotels. We will make a point with our team.
The cleaning of the room is by default not done - with the exception of the third day of the stay - if you do not request it via the MoodPad. We have put this choice in place following our many requests from our guests. This system is in place in all our hotels.
Whether you take one or more drinks, rest assured we will always be happy to have you by our side. A discussion will be made with the cloudM team.
We hope to see you again in one of our citizenM hotels, like London, Paris or even Taipei.
citizen Olivier

reviews.text: Excellent in most every way.  What you might expect from a $300 per night in the late spring.  Across the street from Metro and RER but not close to anything else notable.  Very new and modern.  Black and red art them everywhere.  Breakfast NOT included.  Modern iPad controlled room which mostly worked (try the roomâs mood lighting in âParty Modeâ).  Ability to check out large umbrellas.  Free Evian water in the room which is nice.  Various international electric outlets (US included).  Nice view of the Seine from the 16th floor cocktail lounge.  Friendly service and everyone speaks English.

Staff , facilities, and functions were brilliant for the budget. also that view ! Sure those rooms are not the largest or the most spacious but the beds are comfortable, the rooms clean, and the location brilliant.

Conveniently located 5 mins from Gare de Lyon. Rooms are small but bed is King size and therefore occupies a big portion of the room. Only basic amenities avail, so don't expect slippers or night gowns.

Very modern feeling (smart room, self checking in) . The room are small but very clean. The bed is very comfortable.
The staff are very helpful and nice.
Good for business trips.

Hyper modern hotel where you can check in yourself on the computers at the 1st floor. Modern room sparkling clean and tablet controlled. Nice view at the bar on the 16th floor where you can see the eifeltower shining at night. Only con is the music everywhere. And at the end it's not expensive so you get good value for your money.

If you like domotics rooms, this is your place to stay. I like the hotel system with smart lighting control system for the mood you want to. The IPad controls everything and give you recommendations where to eat, dance, visit and shop. Good Movies to watch and catch up the station radio in French! Good music to start your day. Comfortable furnitures and the shower itâs so relaxing. Breakfast itâs ok and friendly service. The check in have to be with your QR code and the registration itâs do it by yourself. Also, if you donât want room service the profit that hotel safe itâs donated to an NGO for kids. For the other hand, the bar itâs only open until 00:00. So better if you go to a bar around the hotel.
Nice modern hotel. The best place for meeting with the people. It's lobby is really relaxing place. The rooms are small, really for sleeping only, but nice and simply equipped.

Hi Katerina, thanks for sharing your experience with us, great to hear you enjoyed the modern feel and cleanliness of our hotel. Our housekeeping team puts a lot of heart in what they do, so our guests can enjoy a clean and welcoming environment. Sorry to hear the area is not your favorite, but indeed, the metro is a stone away so you can always escape to you favorite parts of town. Also, just around the corner from the hotel you can enjoy a nice walk along the beautiful Seine, we find that to be a jewel! Hope to see you soon, citizenAlina

I think this hotel is great. The staff are helpful and friendly. The breakfast is good and the coffee is terrific- thatâs saying a lot given most coffee places in France are merd. I would stay here again.
Modern and clean, the bed is very comfortable and the room is a good size.  The location is convenient, with good public transport connections but it is not the most charming part of Paris.
Close to station which is good and bad. Nothing to do in the immediate area.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your insights. Indeed, our hotel's proximity to the station is designed to provide easy access for our guests. For leisure activities, the city offers a variety of attractions a short distance away but we always recommend the lively Bastille area a short 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. We hope you'll have an opportunity to explore more on your next visit. 

Best Regards

CitizenChristian

reviews.ownerResponse:
Overall, I'm satisfied with my stay at this hotel. The setting is truly pleasant, the retro decor particularly appealed to me, and the dining area and bar on the 16th floor allowed us to spend pleasant evenings. The food served all day until 11 p.m. is very good, as are the cocktails, which are very fresh.
However, I'm deducting one star for the room; it seemed relatively small, and we were quite disappointed with the quality of the room and the bed. The mattress had a hole in the corner, and there was a lot of dust on the furniture.
Nevertheless, I'm still very satisfied with my stay overall. The welcome was very warm, and the entire staff was available if we needed anything. The hotel is therefore very nice for short weekend breaks in Paris, being located a few minutes from the city center and close to all amenities.

reviews.text: Cool hotel les chambres sont assez grande pour paris . Deux superbe Bar surtout celui du 16h Etage. Le personnel un peu anglophone. Mais sympa.  C est a cotÃ© de la gare de Lyon donc ideal. Allez y

reviews.text: Concept sympa d'hÃ´tel qui se veut trÃ¨s moderne. On fait le checkin soi mÃªme, pourquoi pas. Chambre petite, mais cosy. Tout est neuf, Ã§a se voit. reviews.text: Cooles Hotel, gefÃ¼hrt von jungen internationalen, super netten Leuten. Tolle Zimmer, teilweise mit fantastischer Aussicht direkt auf Notre Dame und ganz Paris! The technical condition (room doors, shower) sometimes clouds the good overall picture. Bar on the top floor fantastic - view and offer great!

reviews.text:
L'enregistrement est rapide et se fait sur de grandes tablettes tactiles Ã  l'entrÃ©e.
La chambre est propre et fonctionnel, il n'y avait pas de bouilloire dans la chambre mais un frigo ce qui est pratique. La literie est trÃ¨s confortable ! On contrÃ´le les volets et la luminositÃ© de la chambre Ã  l'aide d'une tablette tactile. Nous avons eu une bonne expÃ©rience dans cet hÃ´tel.
reviews.ownerResponse:

The room is clean and functional, there was no kettle in the room but a fridge which was practical. The bedding is very comfortable! We control the shutters and the brightness of the room using a touchscreen tablet. We had a good experience at this hotel.

reviews.text:
Un concept singulier et agrÃ©able. HÃ´tel trÃ¨s bien situÃ© pour visiter Paris. La chambre est fonctionnelle, connectÃ©e mais un peu Ã©troite. Le petit dÃ©jeuner est pris dans un espace zen et le personnel est sympa et rÃ©actif nÃ©anmoins manque de plusieurs sortes de pains.
En ce qui concerne le mÃ©nage dans les chambres au 10Ã¨me Ã©tage une seule personne dÃ©diÃ©e Ã  l'entretien  et la chambre est nettoyÃ©e aux environs de 17H00 ce n'est pas le top. MalgrÃ© tout les prestations sont bonnes.

A unique and pleasant concept. Hotel very well located for visiting Paris. The room is functional, connected but a little narrow. Breakfast is taken in a zen space and the staff is friendly and responsive, however there is a lack of several types of bread.
Regarding cleaning in the rooms on the 10th floor only one person dedicated to maintenance and the room is cleaned around 5:00 p.m. this is not the best. Despite everything, the services are good.

reviews.text:
Come qualitÃ  prezzo siamo ad alti livelli,  l hotel e molto vicino alla stazione gare de Lyon, quasi tutte le camere si affacciano sul senna. Design molto curato sia in area comune che in stanza,  quest ultima gestita completamente da un tabelt tramite la domotica.
Colazione buona, nella media , amche la cucina di buon livello e con prezzi nella media (antipasti tra 5 E 8 euro E piatti principali tra 15 E 18 euro) molto carino il cocktail bar amo ultimo piano con vista su tutta la cittÃ .
Lo consiglierei piu per un viaggio di lavoro ma Ã¨ adatto anche per un viaggio di coppia.
Manca la 5 stella perchÃ© alcune cose sono da migliorare,  su tutto il bagno,  la doccia e il wc sono all interno della stanza coperte da un muretto quasi trasparente,  il lavandino invece Ã¨ proprio all interno della stanza , davvero poco pratico, anche il letto troppo alto e confina con il muro su tre lati , quindi ce solo un lato disponibile per salire sul letto (questo per quanto riguarda la mia stanza ad angolo,  forse in altre stanze non si presenta questo problema).
Ultima nota il check in che Ã¨ gestito tramite un pc , interessante ma forse si va a perdere un Po il contatto umano con il receptionist, va a gusti a me non ha convinto molto.
Nel complesso sono stato bene ci tornerei e lo consiglierei.
reviews.ownerResponse:
In terms of price quality we are at a high level, the hotel is very close to the Gare de Lyon station, almost all the rooms overlook the Seine. Very refined design both in the common area and in the room, the latter managed completely by a tabelt via home automation.
Good breakfast, average, the cuisine is also of a good standard and with average prices (starters between 5 and 8 euros and main courses between 15 and 18 euros), the cocktail bar is very nice, I love the top floor with a view over the whole city.
I would recommend it more for a business trip but it is also suitable for a couple's trip.
The 5 star is missing because some things need improvement, throughout the bathroom, the shower and the toilet are inside the room covered by an almost transparent wall, the sink on the other hand is right inside the room, really impractical, also the bed is too high and borders the wall on three sides, so there is only one side available to get onto the bed (this concerns my corner room, perhaps this problem does not arise in other rooms).
Last note, check in which is managed via a PC, interesting but perhaps you lose a little human contact with the receptionist, it's a matter of taste and it didn't convince me much.
Overall I had a good time there I would go back and recommend it.

reviews.text:
Alles in allem ein guter Aufenthalt fÃ¼r eine Nacht.

reviews.text: Sono 2 volte che pernotto in questo hotel e francamente mi trovo bene. Non Ã¨ adatto a tutti in particolare perchÃ© le camere sono molto piccole, con il letto che - anche se generoso - confina con le pareti. Quindi claustrofobici state alla larga. Per il resto Ã¨ molto pulito e ha un letto comodo; tutto quello che cerchi,  dal comando sull'iPad per le tende fino al cestino del piccolo lavandino sono a portata di mano. Non Ã¨ un hotel per persone che amano stare in camera ma piuttosto che vogliono mettersi in moto e vivere Parigi. E se proprio non vi va potete stare nelle ampie sale-salotti messi a disposizione. reviews.ownerResponse: I've stayed at this hotel twice now, and honestly, I'm quite happy with it. It's not for everyone, especially because the rooms are very small, with the bedâthough generousâthrusting up against the walls. So, claustrophobic guests should stay away. Otherwise, it's very clean and has a comfortable bed; everything you need, from the iPad control for the curtains to the wastebasket in the small sink, is within easy reach. It's not a hotel for people who like to stay in their rooms, but rather for those who want to get moving and experience Paris. And if that's not your thing, you can stay in the spacious lounges. You can see the location and connections on the map.

-la vue qu'offrent certaines chambres. ( Un conseil ne payez pas  en plus pour avoir une vue sur Paris. Je ne l'ai pas fait et j'ai quand mÃªme eu une vue sur la tour Eiffel et le SacrÃ© Coeur.)
-L'hÃ´tel est idÃ©alement situÃ© puisqu'il est Ã  deux pas de la gare de Lyon ce qui permet de rejoindre le centre de Paris en 20 min en mÃ©tro.
-Le personnel est agrÃ©able et aidant lorsque l'on a des questions.

Les points nÃ©gatifs:
- le petit dÃ©jeuner ne vaut pas son prix.
-Le manque d'intimitÃ© dans la chambre car la salle de bain est trÃ¨s spÃ©ciale...

Je recommande donc cet hÃ´tel pour tous ceux qui dÃ©sirent visiter ou travailler Ã  Paris.
reviews.ownerResponse:
I am very satisfied with my stay at Citizen M Paris Gare de Lyon, which is a state-of-the-art establishment. In fact, in each of the rooms there is an Ipad which allows you to fully control the room.

I would say the highlights of the rooms and the hotel are:
-the bed which is very large and very comfortable.
-the possibility of watching recently released films for free.
-the view offered by certain rooms. (A word of advice: don't pay extra to have a view of Paris. I didn't do it and I still had a view of the Eiffel Tower and the SacrÃ© Coeur.)
-The hotel is ideally located since it is a stone's throw from the Gare de Lyon which allows you to reach the center of Paris in 20 minutes by metro.
-The staff is pleasant and helpful when you have questions.

The negative points:
- breakfast is not worth the price.
-The lack of privacy in the room because the bathroom is very special...

I therefore recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to visit or work in Paris.

reviews.ownerResponse: Extra-large and comfortable bed, room as futuristic as ever, and very welcoming staff. The only downside: the free on-demand movie catalog wasn't available yet... But hey, it doesn't matter, we were treated to two free glasses of champagne. Very good quality hot meals.

reviews.text: Vraiment cool comme chaÃ®ne dâhÃ´tel, jamais Ã©tÃ© dÃ©Ã§u, trÃ¨s propre, moderne, les chambres correspondent aux descriptions. Le personnel est disponible et accueillant. Le rapport qualitÃ©/prix est trÃ¨s correct!
reviews.ownerResponse: Really cool hotel chain, never been disappointed, very clean, modern, the rooms match the descriptions. The staff is available and welcoming. The quality/price ratio is very good!

reviews.text:
HÃ´tel trÃ¨s contemporain, dÃ©coration design. TrÃ¨s grand lit super confortable mais on ne peut pas circuler autour, chambre assez petite.

reviews.ownerResponse: Very contemporary hotel with designer decor. A very large, super-comfortable bed, but you can't move around it, and the room is quite small. Minimalist reception, everything is computerized. Ideal location for sightseeing.

reviews.text: Dommage de n'Ãªtre accueillies qu'en anglais... ? Sinon, emplacement idÃ©al Ã  200 mÃ¨tres de la gare de Lyon. Pour le reste, accueil, propretÃ© et fonctionnel. Lits trÃ¨s grands, c'est un plus quand on est grand

reviews.ownerResponse: Except for the bed's position in the room, the service provided was excellent. Inconvenient entry and exitâonly on one sideâfor a partner.

reviews.text: Hotel qui a du look et un concept sympa. But reception on computer and without human contact or useful information, no room service (breakfast in particular) and narrow room for a 4 star. The worst is the bathroom with sink in the bedroom and translucent shower cubicle/WC. THE best: the breakfast is extraordinary and the bed very comfortable

A gym +/- spa might be missing for a little extra.

reviews.ownerResponse: The rooms were very practical and simple, and only the basics were provided, which was a bit disappointing. reviews.text: The âautomatic and digitalâ service is appreciable during this COVID period. I really don't regret my choice! A top hotel! Everything is adjustable and it's very pleasant! Thank you for this stay!

reviews.ownerResponse: Large hotel with every comfort. A bed at the back of the room against the bay window overlooking the Gare de Lyon. LED lighting with remote control to control the color and intensity in the room. Large space for breakfast and meals.

reviews.text: Ein Design-Hotel in bester Lage an der Seine in Paris. Wie bei allen CitizenM sind auch hier die Zimmer sehr kompakt. Die Ausstattung lÃ¤sst allerdings kaum WÃ¼nsche offen. reviews.ownerResponse: A design hotel in a prime location on the Seine in Paris. As with all CitizenM, the rooms here are very compact. However, the equipment leaves little to be desired. Unlike in London, the staff still lacked a bit of professionalism. But this branch hasn't been around for very long. I will come back.

This hotel was built a little south of Gare de Lyon. ||The south side of Gare de Lyon (although it's only an appearance and there's no real harm if you're used to it) has a slightly scary atmosphere with drunk immigrants staggering around. ||||To get to the hotel, it's easy to find by simply leaving the station and walking on the ground. ||||The good thing about this hotel is that it's new and the facilities are clean, but the check-in is automated and they asked me if I wanted a late check-out when I checked in. ||||My flight to Japan leaves Charles de Gaulle after 8 p.m., so I was able to secure a hotel in Paris until 4 p.m., which was helpful. It was an additional 30 euros. ||||The room was well designed and the bed was spacious. ||I was also grateful that they provided two bottles of water for free, as I drank until late at night before going home.

reviews.ownerResponse: The hotel is very comfortable and convenient to stay at. The hotel itself and the rooms are very stylish and at the same time simple. Near the hotel is the Lyon railway station, the Bastille square and a huge number of restaurants for every taste. The breakfast is large and delicious.

Location: Close to the train station. Five stars.
Clean: 3 stars, not very clean...
Space: 3 stars It's a bit narrow and the shower room is a bit narrow... I think it's okay for the price.
Temperature: A little cold, only up to 24 degrees.
Friendliness: Perhaps because there are a lot of tourists in Paris, most people are unfriendly, but the accommodations here are still friendly.
Conclusion: Good for backpackers in their 20s or on business trips, but somewhat lacking for couples in their 30s or older.

reviews.ownerResponse:
Hotel different from classic hotels. Check-in on computer at reception, control of lights, heating, blinds, TV on tablet. Panoramic bar on the 16th floor and bar on the reception level.
Small downside...the maintenance is not the best.

The hotel is on the left side of the exit from the ground level platform. Pass through the skywalk and the building and go down the stairs at the end, or take the escalator down one level to the ground floor and cross the pedestrian crossing. It's about a 5 minute walk.
The lobby is on the 2nd floor, take the elevator up and check in using the automatic check-in machine.
There was a restaurant on the lobby floor serving breakfast and evening snacks (limited variety) and bar service, and a bar on the 16th floor.
There weren't many places to eat nearby, but there were a few on the second floor of a building facing the station.
The rooms are functional and have the bare minimum. There is no refrigerator.
