reviews.text:
Superbe hÃ´tel situÃ© au pied de la gare de Lyon ! S'il ne paye pas de mine de l'extÃ©rieur, l'intÃ©rieur vaut le dÃ©tour avec sa dÃ©coration pop moderne, colorÃ©e et chaleureuse. Il est notamment possible d'aller manger Ã  la CanteenM au 1er Ã©tage ou de boire un verre au CloudM au dernier Ã©tage.
Concernant la CanteenM, je regrette l'absence de service Ã  table et le fait que les commandes soient traitÃ©es au compte-goutte (impossible de manger en mÃªme temps si vous Ãªtes nombreux, Ã  moins de manger froid.) Les baos au porc et le curry d'agneau Ã  la noix de coco sont dÃ©licieux ! Les tarifs sont globalement Ã©levÃ©s mais la qualitÃ© est prÃ©sente et on paye aussi le cadre.
Le CloudM est un skybar situÃ© tout en haut de l'immeuble avec une vue imprenable sur le centre de Paris, Notre-Dame et la Seine. Il est possible d'y commander de belles planches de charcuterie et fromage pour accompagner vos boissons. LÃ  encore, pas adaptÃ© pour les groupes car on nous a refusÃ© de diviser l'addition pour le rÃ¨glement...
L'ensemble du personnel est trÃ¨s agrÃ©able et professionnel !
MalgrÃ© quelques points Ã  amÃ©liorer pour les groupes, je recommande cet endroit !
reviews.ownerResponse:
Superb hotel located at the foot of Lyon train station! If it doesn't look much from the outside, the interior is worth the detour with its modern, colorful and warm pop decoration. In particular, it is possible to eat at CanteenM on the 1st floor or have a drink at CloudM on the top floor.
Concerning the CanteenM, I regret the absence of table service and the fact that orders are processed in a trickle (impossible to eat at the same time if there are many of you, unless you eat cold.) The pork baos and the coconut lamb curry are delicious! The prices are generally high but the quality is there and you also pay for the setting.
The CloudM is a skybar located at the top of the building with a breathtaking view of the center of Paris, Notre-Dame and the Seine. It is possible to order beautiful charcuterie and cheese platters to accompany your drinks. Again, not suitable for groups because we were refused to split the bill for payment...
The entire staff is very pleasant and professional!
Despite a few points to improve for groups, I recommend this place!

reviews.ownerResponse: The hotel's facade is discreet and dark. What a contrast to the impression we get when we enter the common areas after checking in on the second floor. Modern, cool and cozy with a good atmosphere. The room was tiny. Not easy to place two suitcases without them getting in the way. The facilities had a quality feel. Good shower, but I wish there was some heat there. Lovely big bed - even though it is pressed against the wall and there is a large duvet. So it is best if you know the person you are sharing the room with well. The windows cannot be opened. The air conditioning does not go lower than 18 degrees. It was not cold enough for Norwegian tourists, and at the same time it was too cold in the bathroom. The bar on the top floor had a great view of Paris. Quiet and good atmosphere. Could have been open longer than until 0000.

reviews.text: Lieu trÃ¨s agrÃ©able...

I did not like how small the room is. They told you that the room has ironing facilities. That is not true; there is an ironing room on the floor but not in the room. I asked for a kettle and could not get it. I have a baby and needed to prepare milk for her. I needed hot water.  The iconic view from my room was catastrophic and not iconic. I asked FranÃ§ois for a better room and even chatted to a staff via booking.com but nothing doing. No follow up was made on the matter. When we checked in, no valet services were provided, we had to take our luggage to our room by ourselves. It is not easy after a 13 hours flight. The laundry service (outsourced) is just a scam in my opinion.  The staff doesn't speak FRENCH. I ASKED FRANCOIS AND HE SAID NO.

Pros
Nice location
High tech room with iPad control
Comfortable mattress
Staff very friendly

Cons
Small room
Small bed
Hand washing basin inside room
No cupboard
No kettle nor slippers and many stuff that should be there for a 4 star hotel

Generally value for money losing

The good things: Location (a lot of transport options and restaurants in the area), the hotel crew (best ever!), A/C system, cleaning and the common facilities.||The bad: soundproofing between rooms (awake every morning by cleaners in other rooms), the bathroom solution (absolutely no privacy - and not very effective!), the lack of small (low) pillows and the fire (emergency exit) markings

This hotel has great location and great lobby service. However, the reason i gave 3 stars is because the room thermostat does not allow to make the room warmer. My wife and I stayed there 3 weeks ago and we were shivering eventhough we were under the blanket as the room temp was still not warm enough for us during winter. For travellers who need a warmer room, this hotel is not for you. Otherwise, hotel is great.

Surprisingly good.
Quiet and very clean room.
Great co-working space.
Correct breakfast.

I like CitizenM when a) traveling solo & b) rates are reasonable.

These type/size of rooms just donât work when Iâm traveling with my wife.

I love the technology aspect, but hate it when it doesnât work perfectly. Pixelization every minute or so on TV channels is annoying. I switched to casting from my device, as this worked much better.

Not sure what housekeeping there is for a two night stay, but I was out all the 2nd day, returned late at night, and my room had not been serviced.

I understand the climate control can not be switched off, but its annoying when the fan rattles every few minutes.

Bed, as usual, very comfortable and the wifi worked well.

Great location for public transport & just 10 min walk to lots of decent eating places.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello citizen Steven,
 We're glad that you appreciate our tech and comfy beds. It's unfortunate to hear that you had a few hiccups with the TV and housekeeping during your stay, that's definitely not the experience we aim for. We're also sorry to hear about the fan rattling - we will let our maintenance team know about this issue so it hopefully does not happen again. Your feedback is valuable to us and we're all ears to any suggestions and comments you have. We are happy that overall you seemed to have a positive experience,
citizen Madelaine

reviews.text:
This hotel felt more like an upmarket hostel to me. Itâs very hard to understand the 4 star rating. My room was relatively clean in terms of the bed and bathrooms, but the other surfaces and walls were stained in a way that made it overall feel dirty. The hallway carpets and lifts were super unclean throughout my stay and the lobby smelled like a canteen. The rooms are small but thatâs clear at the point of booking - it just seemed to me like it would be small but super clean and functional. You also have to go to the canteen to get water, thereâs none in the room. This isnât a huge deal but contributed to the overall budget, rather than luxury feeling.

Pros are itâs very close to the train station, staff were helpful and friendly and it was quite sound proof from outside (3rd floor exterior room).

I suppose itâs hi-tech in that you check yourself in and out, and the blinds are electronic, but thatâs not really too unusual these days. You can only have either all the lights in the room on or all off, which was kind of strange, given thereâs a bedside lamp. The WiFi was very slow when I used it and ended up using my phoneâs network to stream instead.

Itâs nothing terrible but for me wasnât worth the price and their branding as âaffordable luxuryâ makes no sense as it isnât luxurious at all (and doesnât even feel like theyâre trying to be).

Had a good view from our room. Location is close to metro station. No major tourist attraction at walking distance though. The staff is nice but not all. The cleaning needs to be worked on. Bed and blanket have dust and hair on it. Same with corners of the room. Also the hallway carpets are disgusting. Wish the hotel was more clean so I could feel more comfortable during the stay, especially because of the bed bug infested image of Paris.

I stayed here for 5 night during the maison objet paris, the location was great and was close to Gare de lyon station and you can go every where easily, specionaly to paris exhibition. The interior of hotel and room was very nice, and the stuffs were kind and helpful, but here didnât have any facility like cafe or tea in your room even slipper ! The bathroom wasnât very clean and new and need renovated and also the first floor elavator area is smelled very bad.
Supposedly a 4-star hotel but service is more like a budget hotel. Way too cold in the room and the light system is overly complicated.

Standart between Ikea and Apple. Shine bright with poor quality. no, price over 140. â¬ per day are not realistic. Room equipement not functional. i had one request, to clean the armchair from long femal black hairs (i have very short hair). After 3 days the problem was still not solved! Various Staff members cud not deal with. Room was very cold, allways at 21c. They advert grean, safe the planet saving energy but freeze the rooms at 21c, even itâs cold outside. I call that hipocrisy.

A bit disappointing for the price payed. Rooms are very very very small, but clean.
The toilet door does not close properly so there is no privacy between couples sharing the room. Also no vent so smell and humidity takes over the room when bathroom is used.
iPad controls lights, shades and temperature which can be seen as cool but it does not enhance the stay if you ask me.
Breakfast was not outstanding but good.

Far away from the attractions of the city. Pleasant staff, good variety of breakfast. The room is too small and needs more cleaning attention. We choose room in the eleventh floor in order to avoid the noice but it was very noisy. We stayed three nights and no one visited our room in order to be cleaned.

The bed and the sheet were very confortable, the room was spotless and they also have a very friendly staff.

Though, I was disappointed by several things given that it is a 4 stars hotel :
- you can't open the window
- there was no body lotion
- no possibility to prepare a tea or coffee in the room nor a bottle of water in the fridge
- the shower pressure was really too low, making it very difficult to rinse off the shampoo
- breakfast was not particularly good

PROS: Great location and amicable stuff. Breakfast was very nice and offered many options.
CONS: rooms are very tiny for a not as tiny price, yeah, very technological and all with your own ipad for controlling the room, but you are paying â¬200+/night for changing the color of the lights in your room and a good location. the bathroom is in the same room as the bed and there's barely space for anything. I don't think I would repeat the whole citizenM experience.

Nicely updated modern rooms with an iPad that can be used as a smart remote to control everything (ac, lights, tv,blinds). The only downside to this hotel is the size of the rooms, but I believe the room size is about average compared to most hotels in Paris. The staff was multilingual and check in and check out was easy. We had some minor problem with the sink draining water very slowly. The top floor bar had a good view of the river and the drinks were excellent. Overall, the location is good and I might book a visit again.

I have stayed with citizenM earlier also so I know what I can expect there. My experience this time was absolutely bad. Timing was bad too as there was a failure in water heating system and there was no hot water during peak hours of the day.

In a world of universal plugs there are European plugs every where and no USB connectors also. They disabled American plug point not sure why.

No one came to clean the room. They have put a eloborate process of requesting to clean the room a day in advance. Who has time to check all those things?

As usual the team was helpful, proactive and energetic. Food and drinks in the bar are really good.

It's a good hotel in a excellent location (just 5 min walking from Gare de Lyon). The rooms are small but cozy, with an excellent bed and shower. However, my wife and I didn't like that much of the room cleanness, there was always some dust on the floor. A bit annoying. The iPad to control room in the beginning is cool but too much technology can be troublesome. Why do simple curtains need to be controlled by an iPad? Sometimes it didn't work well.
The living area is superb and super well design, we love it spent time there! As well the bar area, with good drinks and well priced. But the food choices aren't great and we got disappointed with them. We witnessed a lot of people bringing their own food or ordering it through apps.
In general we recommend the hotel and we hope to return in another opportunity.

Same good setup - modern rooms, comfortable beds, designer furniture.
Unfortunately you cannot consume outside food in their so called living room area.
Their breakfast buffet is rather limited for vegetarians and very small for vegans.

This is a decent hotel but I am not sure if its a 4 star to the standard it claims as the room does not include complementary tea and kettle services in the room for the price one pays. I would like to thank the staff member who was kind enough to offer tea and drinks for free on the first day. Otherwise overall experience was decent.

Good staff attitude. However, we arrived early morning due to the train demonstration, we were trapped for three hours and arrived at 4 am next morning yet they didnât even consider to give us any sort of discount. I must say that the room was extremely small, one sided bed so i had to crawl every night to use the toilet. No place to have my suit case. I am used to Paris space limits, bit this is too much especially for the money we paid. Check out time is 11 or else you have to pay extraâ¦ they use technology to control every aspect of the room, check in and check out. Lights, blinds, AC ex
reviews.ownerResponse:
Good afternoon citizen Monirah,
Thanks for choosing us for your stay in Paris. We are glad you are sharing your experience with us because it helps us to improve. Great to know you like our ambassador's approach and attitude, for us is the most important. About the concept of the room, we are sorry it didn't meet your expectations. We also receive good comments about it but we understand it's not what you are looking for. Hope you give us another opportunity to show you more about our qualities. Enjoy your weekend!

reviews.text:
It's ok but not amazing, for the money you pay for it I'd expect more.

Rooms are small with the WC separated by a plastic wall so, if you want privacy this type of layout is not for you.
Everything in the room is controlled by an iPad,  including the multi-coloured shower lights which gives the room a 1980's cheesy  feeling (bad taste if you ask me).

The breakfast is ok with a variety of yogurts, hot and cold food but nothing is organic and if you are not early you won't have fresh food.

Why is it so popular? Because it has the hype of other citizenM hotels around the world, vibrant deco, designer chairs and loud marketing. This particular location is popular with business men (so be prepared to see lots of them), it's right outside one of the main stations in Paris so easy access to public transport.

I gave it 3 stars for its location and the staff. They are actually really helpful. Otherwise I'm afraid it would only be a 2 stars review from me as it's not value for money.
reviews.ownerResponse: Hi Esther Duran, Thank you for feedback. We are sorry to hear that you didn't like the layout of the rooms. Our rooms are developed for the modern traveller thus focusing on the neccessary items such as XL bed, shower, free Wi-Fi and movies. We took out all the clutter but we do take our guests feedback into consideration for our future hotels. Concerning the breakfast we are always open to suggestions in order to improve ourselves. Hopefully you'll give us another try. Safe travels, citizenM team

reviews.text: We had stayed in better citizenM's in other cities. This one looked very basic, the reception area reminded me of a youth hostel. In the bedrooms, the windows are very small compared to the long, wide windows in other citizenM's. So the view to the Eiffel was disappointing.The location is great for metros, trains and buses but unfortunately there are a lot of beggars and homeless people in the area so it feels very rundown. Night time doesn't feel very safe in that area.
reviews.ownerResponse: Hi Sil! Thank you for your review. This citizenM is a bit different as we refurbished it and didn't build it ourselves. However we put in our usual design and lovely art items. We're sorry to hear that you didn't feel safe in the area. We appreciate all feedback as we always learn from it. Safe travels, citizen Dagmar

reviews.text: The hotel is very stylish, processes very digitalized and staff is very friendly. Excellent location right next to Gare de Lyon.  Unfortunately, in my room the water tab was ripped out of the sink, the toilet would not flush properly and nearly no water pressure for the shower. Clearly too many issues for a hotel in this price class.
Good rooms, amenities and services, but the windows are blocked with stickers, so after paying extra for a room on high floor for a view of Paris, it was disappointing.

I've never stayed at a Citizen M hotel before so cannot compare this to any of their other hotels. I found this particular one great for the fancy extras, ie self check in which avoids standing in queues, free up to date in room film selection, ipad in room, continental, US and UK in room plug sockets but very disappointing on the basics. In terms of the basics, I have two bones of contention. Firstly, although I was able to access the in room films I was unable to access any TV channels. When I selected the TV guide on the TV, it claimed to be loading, 20 minutes later, still loading.... I informed a member of staff the next morning who stated that someone would have a look at this, when I came in that evening, still loading......! It does not appear that anyone had rectified the issue or bothered to inform me what was going on. Second bone of contention is the coffee situation at breakfast. The bar where breakfast is available has a fancy pants coffee machine for those wanting cappuccino etc at breakfast. For those who would like a bog standard Americano, there is a flask of coffee available- 1 small flask for a bar that probably has a capacity of up to 150 people. Day 1, I gave staff my room number as breakfast was included and then got my food and drink--the flask was empty, as I saw a staff member take this away I was expecting it to be returned in a few minutes. 10-15 minutes later, still no coffee, I asked the girl by the coffee machine for an Americano due to the situation--I was informed that I would have to go to the front of the bar where I gave my room number to request for this-really unnecessary considering I had given her my room number earlier and she was already aware that everything was paid for. At this point a member of staff turned up with the flask, which didn't work! I waited another 5 minutes and then had to leave as I had to get to an appointment, so no coffee at breakfast. The rest of my trips to the bar for breakfast turned into a ridiculous ritual of firstly checking if there was coffee in the flask (zero every morning, no matter what time I was there) before giving my room number and requesting a coffee from the machine to avoid multiple trips to the front of the bar. Not a good situation for those who like a coffee at breakfast! I would have given this place 3.5 out of 5 but wasn't prepared to round up to a 4 as it didn't make the grade. The hotel is in a good location by the Gare de Lyon with great number of metro and RER lines available and the rooms are very clean, however I found the 2 mentioned issues a let down.

A CitizenM like all others, just beware half the rooms will have a back alley view (pic). You're much better off in CitizenM La DÃ©fense, which by the way offers a lower rate. This location is always superfull, personnel very stressed out; if this is your first CitizenM experience, you might think it's ****. And yes, half the employees don't speak French.

Clean room, not the greatest service received. Missing welcome drink on arrival, I Pad still set up for previous guest and did not charge. Location is great for proximity to Gare De Lyon but the benefits end there.

Not the best citizenM in which I have been. Not very clean, the window in the room is smaller than other citizenM and the location is
ok, not exceptional. If you book with the view on the Senna though, itâs worthy
reviews.ownerResponse: Hi citizen Elisa, Thank you for your review. Sorry to hear that your experience with us was not on the same level as the other citizenM's you visited. We have shared your feedback with our teams as well to be able to improve ourselves. Hopefully we can welcome you back again, citizen Dagmar

reviews.text: constanly in elevators. the style isnât great. the tech in the rooms is amazing. location is weird.
Super DUPER tiny rooms and bathroom.... almost unbelievable. Customer service was so so. However the hotel is close to cafes and the train station so that was a plus.
Very small room. Breakfast Very little items. Love the check in and out. Value for money is not satisfactory

Over all, it's a very nice hotel, the rooms are small but very efficiently designed, the self check-in and check-out is easy and the helper is always around however reducing cost with smart technology and rooms size optimisation should never compromise the basic standard and comfort, take coffee for example, the room doesn't have a coffee at all, sometimes there is a fine line what should be optimised and what not, coffee is a very standard item every room should have it
Very clean and modern, ok for 1 night because the room is very small.  Overpriced considering the size of the room.
Rooms are good. Rooftop Bar not worth the name. This so called rooftop bar is the worst bs.........
The rooms and public areas are super. Fun, and well designed. But the 'hood is crummy.
Nice hotel but a bit modern for me, the staff are very friendly.

Nice hotel.
But donât forget something in you room no way to get back,
reviews.ownerResponse:
Dear Citizen,
Thank you for your comment,
If I do understand it seems that you have lost something, you still can contact us by e-mail to know if we had find him, we use to keep everything that we found for 01 year and 01 day to be exact, and if we don't have the chance to find, we reply by e-mail.
Thank You
A

reviews.text: good hotel in front of Gare de Lyon, very particular reception and overall ambiance
very small room for the price and check in is annoying given you have to do it by yourself
Just for short stay .F &B is not interesting , you should go outside there are many others restaurants like French Brasserie
this is the most inhuman hotel I have ever stayed in why not go the whole hog and use all Roberts or better sleep on the streets
Was ok but customer service was lacking. Did see a rat in the bar/ breakfast area in the night.
Clean and modern rooms. Breakfast too basic.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Dear Carl Lumder,
Thank you for your review. We're sorry to hear that you found the breakfast too basic, we're always open to suggestions of our guests so we can improve our services.
Hopefully we can welcome you back again soon.
Safe travels, citizen Dagmar

reviews.text: Nice place with great staff, but the breakfast was over priced.
Small rooms. Modern. Poor service
Expensive price, but low quality of the room, which is really tiny!
Nice modern and clean hotel.

Es un hotel que en mi opiniÃ³n no se ajusta al estÃ¡ndar de calidad que uno espera de un hotel de cuatro estrellas. De concepto muy moderno, con mucha conectividad por todos lados, con app, tablet, self-checking que puede llegar a desorientarte. EstÃ¡ pensado para un pÃºblico joven que busque sobre todo funcionalidad. La decoraciÃ³n de los salones del hall y el restaurante es una delicia. Muy bien decorado y hanbiente muy confortable. El tamaÃ±o de las habitaciones es muy reducido, imagino que segÃºn sea tu tarifa, en mi caso bÃ¡sicamente una cama grande que ocupaba la mitad de la habitaciÃ³n, con la tele encima de los pies y el resto del espacio repartido entre una ducha, inodoro, todo muy juntito, y un lavabo allÃ­ en medio de la habitaciÃ³n. La situaciÃ³n del hotel es inmejorable, a un paso de Notre Dame, conexiÃ³n directa al aeropuerto de Orly por metro, eso lo hace especialmente recomendable para visitar la ciudad.  La tenciÃ³n de los empleado fue buena aunque me habrÃ­a gustado encontrar alguien por alli que hablase mi idioma, quizÃ¡s por eso no me enterÃ© bien de como funcionaba la limpieza en la habitaciÃ³n y no subieron a limpiarla. Tienes que pedir expresamente que limpien tu habitaciÃ³n por la tablet, si no no te la limpian, lo cual me parece un poco sorprendente, la verdad, creo que deberÃ­a ser lo opuesto, creo. En fin, en general todo bien y la prÃ³xima vez confÃ­o en enterarme mejor.
reviews.ownerResponse: In my opinion, this is a hotel that doesn't meet the quality standards expected of a four-star hotel. It has a very modern concept, with a lot of connectivity everywhere, with apps, tablets, and self-check-in, which can be disorienting. It's designed for a younger audience looking for functionality above all else. The decor in the lobby and restaurant is delightful. Very well decorated and the atmosphere is very comfortable. The rooms are very small, I imagine depending on your rate. In my case, it was basically a large bed that took up half the room, with the TV at my feet, and the rest of the space divided between a shower, toilet, all very close together, and a sink right in the middle of the room. The hotel's location is unbeatable, just a stone's throw from Notre Dame and with a direct metro connection to Orly Airport, making it especially recommended for visiting the city. The staff was attentive, although I would have liked to find someone there who spoke my language. Perhaps that's why I didn't fully understand how the room cleaning worked, and they didn't come up to clean it. You have to specifically request that your room be cleaned using the tablet; otherwise, they won't clean it for you, which I find a little surprising. Honestly, I think it should be the other way around. Anyway, everything was fine, and I hope to find out more about it next time.

reviews.text:

Nous sommes ravis que vous ayez apprÃ©ciÃ© l'expÃ©rience unique que notre hÃ´tel offre. reviews.text: Bellissimo hotel per lâ arredamento, sia negli spazi comuni che nelle camere, ma la poca empatia del personale fa abbassare il punteggio. Dover spreparare la colazione Ã¨ inaccettabile, cosÃ¬ come il non poter tostare il pane. Da rivedere inoltre lâilluminazione dellâingresso di notte.
reviews.ownerResponse: The hotel is beautifully decorated, both in the common areas and the rooms, but the staff's lack of empathy lowers its rating. Having to waste breakfast is unacceptable, as is not being able to toast bread. The entrance lighting at night also needs to be reconsidered.

reviews.text:
Notre sÃ©jour de 2 nuits s'est bien passÃ© dans l'hÃ´tel. La chambre est minimaliste et l'agencement assez Ã©troit mais c'est le concept des Citizen, assez clair quand on le rÃ©serve.
Les salons sont quant Ã  eux chaleureux et trÃ¨s dÃ©corÃ©s. Le cÃ´tÃ© high tech a ses avantages et ses inconvÃ©nients, peu d'interaction avec le personnel bien que celui ci ait Ã©tÃ© courtois et serviable.
Notre chambre Ã©tait propre, mais les draps avaient des tÃ¢ches qui n'ont pas l'air de partir au long des lavages, c'est quand mÃªme bof bof pour un hÃ´tel 4 Ã©toiles. Il est vrai que les portes claquent fort et que le bruit se rÃ©percute.
L'emplacement correspondait Ã  nos besoins pour cette escapade : j'ai profitÃ© du Black Friday pour accÃ©der Ã  un tarif acceptable, mais clairement je ne paierai jamais le prix de base pour cet hÃ´tel.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Dear Guest,

We are delighted to hear that your two-night stay with us went well. The citizenM concept focuses on comfort, excellent sleep, and a fantastic shower. That's why our rooms are standard in size, as you mentioned.

It's nice to know that you enjoyed our warm and beautifully decorated lounges. They are designed to provide our guests with a comfortable space to relax and recharge.

Regarding the high-tech aspect, we realize it can have its pros and cons. However, we are delighted that you found our staff courteous and helpful.

We note your comments regarding the linens in your room. We place great importance on cleanliness and hygiene, and we regret that you encountered this issue.

Finally, we are pleased that our hotel's location met your needs. We strive to offer our guests excellent value for money.

Thank you again for your constructive feedback.

Madelaine

reviews.text: Chambre bien Ã©quipÃ©e et confortable mais le check out peu efficace, facture non reÃ§ue par mail alors que toutes les coordonnÃ©es sont donnÃ©es Ã  l'arrivÃ©e
reviews.ownerResponse: Well-equipped and comfortable room but checkout was inefficient, invoice not received by email even though all contact details were given on arrival.

reviews.text:
Du copier coller dans chaque hÃ´tel, c'est une chaÃ®ne, pas grand chose Ã  dire,
La rÃ©ception au 1er Ã©tage, pas franchement convivial.
Nous n'y retournerons pas.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Copy-paste from each hotel, it's a chain, not much to say.
The reception on the first floor isn't exactly friendly.
We won't be returning.

reviews.text: Cuando viajas a paris en pareja, quieres tener una experiencia completa , desde la ciudad hasta lo que se convertira en tu hogar por esas noches. Entiendo que la habitaciÃ³n no fue la que esperaba .
reviews.ownerResponse: When you travel to Paris as a couple, you want a complete experience, from the city to what will become your home for those nights. I understand that the room wasn't what you expected.

reviews.text: Dommage que pour les petits dÃ©jeuners on informe pas le client que tout est compris et que l on insiste pour lui faire prendre un Espresso alors qu'il y a des cafetiÃ¨re de cafÃ© a disposition sur le cÃ´tÃ© et du coup on vous fait payer un petit dÃ©jeuner plus un Espresso.
reviews.ownerResponse: It's a shame that for breakfasts we don't inform the customer that everything is included and that we insist on making them have an Espresso when there are coffee makers available on the side and as a result they make you pay for breakfast plus an Espresso.

reviews.text:
plus de 8 euros rien qu'en taxe de sÃ©jour, c'est juste abusÃ©.
Personnel fort aimable mÃªme si dans un hÃ´tel d'affaire je prÃ©fÃ¨re le personnel hÃ´telier aux GO de clubs de vacances.(le chahut en salle de petit dÃ©jeuner tÃ´t le matin, c'est un peu dur pour les oreilles)
En plus si vous voulez rÃ©clamer une facture ou les joindre au tÃ©lÃ©phone, il n'y a qu'un automate en anglais qui vous rÃ©pond.

reviews.ownerResponse:
More than 8 euros in tourist tax alone is simply outrageous.
Very friendly staff, even though in a business hotel I prefer hotel staff to resort managers. (The early morning commotion in the breakfast room is a bit hard on the ears.)
Plus, if you want to request a bill or reach them by phone, there's only an English-speaking operator who answers.
For that reason alone, I wouldn't come back.

reviews.text:
HÃ´tel idÃ©alement situÃ© Ã  la gare de Lyon pour de courts sÃ©jours.
L'Ã©tablissement est moderne, l'enregistrement se fait de maniÃ¨re autonome sur des bornes d'enregistrement et de faÃ§on assez simple.
Les chambres quant Ã  elles sont petites. AprÃ¨s un contrÃ´le de propretÃ©, je me suis rendu compte que le sol n'Ã©tait pas propre. J'ai soulevÃ© le matelas et j'ai dÃ©couvert de nombreux cheveux, miettes et poussiÃ¨re.
Les fenÃªtres ne s'ouvrent pas, il est donc impossible d'aÃ©rer et les murs sont assez fins , assez pour entendre ce qui se passe dans la chambre communicante.
Service hÃ´telier inexistant pour un 4 Ã©toiles.
Etablissement proposant des services high tech sympathiques, tout se contrÃ´le via une tablette (Tv, chauffage, clim, lumiÃ¨re, stores, rideauxâ¦)
Ideal pour de courts sÃ©jours et pour des personnes de jeunes Ã¢ges ne recherchant le confort mais la praticitÃ©.
Avis commun avec des proches qui ont occupÃ© une chambre similaire.

Je ne recommande pas pour de longs sÃ©jours confortables.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hotel ideally located at Lyon train station for short stays.
The establishment is modern, check-in is done independently at check-in terminals and is quite simple.
The rooms are small. After a cleanliness check, I realized that the floor was not clean. I lifted the mattress and discovered lots of hair, crumbs and dust.
The windows do not open, so it is impossible to ventilate and the walls are quite thin, enough to hear what is happening in the connecting room.
Hotel service non-existent for a 4 star.
Establishment offering friendly high-tech services, everything is controlled via a tablet (TV, heating, air conditioning, lights, blinds, curtains, etc.)
Ideal for short stays and for young people not looking for comfort but practicality.
Shared opinion with relatives who occupied a similar room.

I do not recommend for long comfortable stays.

reviews.text:
Camere piccole ma moderne. CiÃ² che non abbiamo amato per niente sono le seguenti caratteristiche : 1 nessuna possibilitÃ  di spegnere totalmente il climatizzatore. 2 tutto troppo digitale (meno male che ho trovato un telecomando per la tv senza dipendere da Tablet) 3 letto con piumone unico senza lenzuola e cuscini molli.

In ogni caso i lati negativi ahimÃ¨ hanno prevalso su quelli positivi (per oltre 200 euro a notte aggiungo). Colazione a 18 euro a persona Ã¨ una follia. L'abbiamo fatta fuori nella adiacente stazione
reviews.ownerResponse:
Small but modern rooms. What we didn't love at all are the following features: 1 no possibility of completely turning off the air conditioning. 2 everything is too digital (thank goodness I found a remote control for the TV without having to depend on a tablet) 3 bed with single duvet without sheets and soft pillows.
We liked: 1 quiet 2 comfortable bathroom and large shower 3 strategic position.
In any case, the negative sides unfortunately prevailed over the positive ones (for over 200 euros per night I add). Breakfast at 18 euros per person is madness. We took her out in the adjacent station

reviews.text:
J'ai rÃ©cemment sÃ©journÃ© dans cet hÃ´tel et je tiens Ã  souligner la gentillesse et la disponibilitÃ© du personnel, qui ont rÃ©ellement contribuÃ© Ã  crÃ©er une atmosphÃ¨re accueillante.

Cependant, il est important de noter que la chambre Ã©tait vraiment trop petite, dÃ©passant largement mes attentes en termes d'espace. Se dÃ©placer Ã  l'intÃ©rieur Ã©tait inconfortable, et cela a considÃ©rablement influencÃ© mon apprÃ©ciation gÃ©nÃ©rale du sÃ©jour. De plus, bien qu'il y ait eu une cabine de douche, l'absence d'une salle de bains proprement dite Ã©tait un inconvÃ©nient notable.

La simple cabine de douche, bien que fonctionnelle, a Ã©galement ajoutÃ© Ã  l'impression d'exiguÃ¯tÃ©. Cela dit, si l'accueil chaleureux est votre prioritÃ© et que l'espace de la chambre n'est pas une grande prÃ©occupation, vous pourriez envisager cet hÃ´tel. Cependant, si vous accordez de l'importance Ã  un espace plus gÃ©nÃ©reux et Ã  des installations de salle de bains complÃ¨tes, il serait peut-Ãªtre prÃ©fÃ©rable d'explorer d'autres options.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello Stephanie,
Thank you for taking the time to share your review and for all your kind words about our team. It makes us very happy!
However, I'm sorry to hear that the room didn't meet your needs. Indeed, as you mentioned, if space in the room is essential for your comfort during your travels, citizenM rooms will likely not be suitable for this preference. We believe it's essential to be transparent in our offerings, and your review will help inform our future guests so they can make an informed decision before booking.
We appreciate your feedback and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again in the future.
Sincerely,
Maria & the citizenM team

reviews.text: Er hing een constante vieze geur in het hotel (ingang, lobby, gangen). Hele hotel kwam smoezelig en verouderd over en ook in de gemeenschappelijke ruimte hing een onprettige vibe door andere gasten waarvan ik me afvraag of dit wel hotelgasten van CitizenM waren. De kamer was net zo smoezelig, waardoor je de hele tijd de behoefte had om je schoenen aan te houden. Zonde, locatie voor het hotel is prima zo vlak naast Gare de Lyon, ondanks dat de omgeving niet direct inspirerend is te noemen. Er zit geen verschil tussen het uitzicht op kantoren of Rue van Gogh, bij beiden kijk je uit op een pand in aanbouw.
reviews.ownerResponse: There was a constant foul odor in the hotel (entrance, lobby, hallways). The entire hotel felt dingy and outdated, and the common areas also had an unpleasant vibe due to other guests, who I wonder if they were actually CitizenM guests. The room was just as grimy, making me feel the need to keep my shoes on all the time. It's a shame, as the hotel's location is excellent, right next to Gare de Lyon, although the surrounding area isn't exactly inspiring. There's no difference between the view of offices or Rue van Gogh; both look out onto a building under construction.

reviews.text: Hotel completamente smart, senza che perÃ² si perfetto: piccoli rumori, confusione al check in automatizzato, ecc.|Quella che Ã¨ scarsa perÃ² Ã¨ la carissima colazione, con bacon di scarsa qualitÃ  e praticamente solo croissant di tutte le forme. Noi abbiamo pagato 25 euro in piÃ¹ al giorno per una camera ai piani alti con vista, ma il sistema le camere alte le dava anche a chi non aveva pagato e comunque a noi l'ha data al decimo piano mentre l'hotel arriva fino al quindicesimo. Prezzi superiori alla media.
reviews.ownerResponse: A completely smart hotel, but not perfect: minor noises, confusion at the automated check-in, etc. | What is lacking, however, is the extremely expensive breakfast, with low-quality bacon and basically just croissants of all shapes. We paid â¬25 more per day for a room on the upper floors with a view, but the system gave higher rooms even to those who hadn't paid, and in any case, they gave us one on the tenth floor, while the hotel offers rooms up to the fifteenth. Prices are above average.

reviews.text: Le tarif d'un Mercure Ã  Paris, le service en moins. Le personnel parle un franÃ§ais assez approximatif. Pas mal de self-service, qui rÃ©duit les coÃ»ts de l'hÃ´tel sans simplifier la vie aux clients. Pas convivial. On n'a pas envie d'y rester au-delÃ  de 2-3 nuits.
reviews.ownerResponse: The price of a Mercure in Paris, minus the service. The staff speaks rather broken French. There's a lot of self-service, which reduces the hotel's costs without making life easier for guests. It's not very friendly. You wouldn't want to stay there longer than 2-3 nights.

reviews.text:
La literie est confortable. Par contre, ne pas Ãªtre petit, le lit est trÃ¨s haut. La couette n'est pas assez grande pour la taille du lit.

Le mÃ©nage est propre au dÃ©marrage mais sur la semaine,  la femme de mÃ©nage n'est pas passÃ©e une seule fois.
Pour un hotel de cette gamme, devoir debarrasser son plateau de petit dejeuner ou aller chercher son plateau pour le repas du soir car il n'y a pas de service en chambre, je trouve cela moyen.

reviews.ownerResponse:
The bedding is comfortable. On the other hand, not being small, the bed is very high. The duvet is not big enough for the size of the bed.
The rooms are insulated for street noise but not at all compared to the noise from other rooms.
The housekeeping is clean at the start but during the week, the cleaning lady did not come once.
For a hotel of this range, having to clear your breakfast tray or go get your tray for the evening meal because there is no room service, I find it average.
Perfect location at the foot of Lyon train station

reviews.text: Wir haben uns sehr geÃ¤rgert, dass wir nicht darauf hingewiesen wurden, dass man proaktiv ein HÃ¤kchen aus dem ipad nehmen muss, damit die Zimmerreinigung erfolgt. We had paid for the cleaning service in advance. Since we didn't return to the hotel until the evening, the cleaning still wasn't done. The promised refund hasn't been received to this day. We also paid the tax three times because an error had been made there, but this was refunded after we complained. The room was a bit too small. Otherwise, everything was fine.

reviews.text:
AmÃ©nagement particulier de la chambre, lit collÃ© aux murs sur 3 cÃ´tÃ©s.

reviews.ownerResponse:
Hi Eric Servain,

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay at CitizenM. Your feedback gives us the opportunity to learn more about our guests and how we can make them happier in the future. We truly appreciate the time you took.

Hotel very close to Lyon train station. Quite original layout of the room with the sink which is directly in the room. It's OK for a single traveler, not so good when there are 2 of you in the room. Very large, very comfortable bed but pressed against the window. Impossible to go around the bed.  TV, light, curtain controlled from a tablet.

Stayed here for 8 nights. I included all breakfast,

I also noticed that towels were not being replenished (you can get them if you let them know), tissues were not being replenished, and the bathroom was not being cleaned. .
I left behind some valuables, but none were stolen.
There was one staff member who was Japanese, and he greeted me and was kind. Thank you very much (^^)

There's only a compartment under the bed and a coat rack. The safe only fits small items. The breakfast can be described as functional.

reviews.ownerResponse: Within a 16mÂ² space, there's almost everything you need. The rooms are trendy and clean. The hotel is very well insulated against noise, which is excellent, of course. The hotel's location near Gare de Lyon is also convenient.

reviews.text: Es bastante caro para el tamaÃ±o de habitaciones que ofrecen. Si es muy comoda la localizacion y el sistema digital de check-in, ascensores, puertas,... Muy moderno las luces de colores de la habitaciÃ³n. Hay que subir a la planta 16 antes de la puesta de sol hasta que se encienda la torre Eiffel.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello Jorge,

Thank you so much for choosing us as your accommodation option in Paris and for sharing your comments with us. It's the best way for us to continue improving. We're glad you enjoyed your experience with us, thanks to our technology, our location, and, above all, the great tip you shared about going to the cloudM bar on the 16th floor at sunsetâa great moment! Regarding the room rate, we'll share your feedback with the Sales team. In general, our prices are the market average. The thing is, there's been a huge demand for Paris since COVID restrictions on travel were lifted, so that generally means the high demand is driving up prices in the city.

We hope to see you here again so we can continue enjoying more sunsets! The best time of year is April and May for that, we look forward to seeing you!

Best regards

Jose M.

reviews.text: HÃ´tel trÃ¨s bien situÃ©, Ã  la dÃ©co soignÃ©e. Cependant la propretÃ© des chambres laisse Ã  dÃ©sirer : bouteille dâeau en plastique vide dans le frigo, recharge de savon vide et surtout pleins de cheveux sur le matelas!

reviews.text:
LâhÃ´tel est situÃ© Ã  2 min Ã  pied de la gare. TrÃ¨s moderne et neuf, il offre une belle prestation branchÃ©e et numÃ©rique. La chambre est complÃ¨tement connectÃ©e et respecte lâenvironnement. Câest apprÃ©ciable.

Je nâai cependant pas du tout apprÃ©ciÃ© le cÃ´tÃ© Â«Â petit dejeunerÂ Â». Certes le Covid est responsable de la nouvelle organisation. Le petit dÃ©jeuner est un sac avec une viennoiserie. Ne vous avisez pas dâen demander une autre le serveur vous dit clairement que non. Câest un yaourt un verre de jus dâorange une poire et un cafÃ©. Ce sera le maximum.

Au prix de la chambre avec petit dÃ©jeuner la prestation du petit dej est assez minable voire inadmissible.
reviews.ownerResponse:
The hotel is located 2 minutes walk from the station. Very modern and new, it offers a beautiful, trendy and digital service. The room is completely connected and respects the environment. Itâs appreciable.

However, I didnât appreciate the âbreakfastâ aspect at all. Certainly Covid is responsible for the new organization. Breakfast is a bag with a pastry. Don't you dare ask for another one, the waiter clearly tells you no. Itâs a yogurt, a glass of orange juice, a pear and a coffee. This will be the maximum.

At the price of the room with breakfast, the breakfast service is quite poor or even unacceptable.

I stayed here for about 5 nights with a group, and if you are used to Japanese service, you would not think of giving it 4 stars. They said it was better than other places, but the service was discriminatory.

I found out at the breakfast buffet that they have different eating areas for white people and Asian people. It's unfortunate that they discriminate so casually, such as Asian people eating in places without windows and white people eating in rooms with windows. Normally, if they know that people are coming for a buffet, they should finish preparations before the people arrive, but of course they are still preparing and only a small amount of food is prepared.

It can't be helped that we stayed for 5 nights and had the same menu for everything, but it's impossible to take the time to prepare and they only prepared a few drinks. The bread tasted good, but what do you think about a 4-star hotel where the only other menu items are eggs, sausages and fruit? I think this is a 4-star hotel, but other hotels are even worse than this, so it's more than just tolerable. I can't help but think about it when I compare it to Japan.

I think the hotel facilities were good.

They say you can drink water from the bathroom, but boil it in the kettle provided before drinking it. France has hard water, so Japanese people may not be used to it. There are only two electrical outlets, so be sure to bring a converter and an extension cord. As for the TV, it only has French programs, so I didn't watch it.

By the way, Japanese people think it's wasteful to leave cups and toothbrushes they used there and use them again, or hang towels, but you should put them in the trash. Towels will not be replaced unless you throw them in the bathtub, so don't hang them out. Most European hotels are like this.
Also, don't hang or hang washed clothes all over the room. They come to clean every day, so make it easy to clean.
Even if you are told that you have paid a tip in advance for a tour, leave a small amount by your pillow. Since most backstage workers are immigrants or black people, tips are their wages. The standard tip is said to be the equivalent of one cup of coffee, but it's hard to get coins, so make sure to have coins when you go shopping. It's important to be considerate even in places that can't be seen.

Also, as a word of advice from overseas, women should not wear lace in black underwear. If you do laundry and hang it out in the room, you may be mistaken for a prostitute and be sexually harassed (one of our group members actually received calls and solicitations from the hotel's waiters). In any case, please be careful of your behavior even inside the hotel.

reviews.ownerResponse:
Location: It's close to Lyon Station, just cross a crosswalk.
Most tourist attractions in Paris take 30 to 40 minutes by bus or 20 to 30 minutes by subway, except for Montmartre, which takes about 40 minutes.
Breakfast: Perfect for those who like salty foods. People who don't like it should only eat bread.
Room condition: Clean and a bit like a capsule hotel? The bathroom is not soundproofed and looks like a plastic box, and the window cannot be opened (standard for deluxe rooms). And, apparently, we sent emails asking for a place with a good view for our honeymoon... but we only saw the company building outside the window and were given the second floor. Is it racism? Or are you just telling lies? First of all, it's fine as long as it's only on the iPad or something. It doesn't matter. Well, it's obvious that Korean broadcasts aren't on, there are no subtitles in movies, and if you're good at English, it's a big deal!! And no slippers. No bathrobes. Even if you call and ask for it, they wonât give it to you. (They say there is nothing.)

reviews.text: Location is definitely the best. Only a block to the train station and several metro lines on hand. Tv channels never worked, even downloading their app to connect my Netflix (so annoying process) , air conditioner not possible to adjust (temperature or fan direction). Room is too small to be a 4 stars hotel. Floor was never cleaned. Everyday I needed to ask for a third towel to my daughter, why they never let it in the room even seeing a crib there?! Maybe the problem was my long one week staying there. A day shouldn't be a problem.

The worst citizenM Iâve been to. Location next to the metro somewhat makes up for it. The rooms and hallway seem older. We got a higher room with âscenicâ view but our view was a construction site with barely the river in the background. Our bathroom door didnât close and we had to leave  the room to get each other privacy. We asked twice in one day to get it fixed and they said maintenance would come, which they never did. The 16th floor bar is completely indoor and seems dated as well. The mojito was good though.

Disappointing Experience at a Poorly Managed Hotel

I recently stayed at this hotel and was disappointed. While the location is convenient, the service and attention are far from satisfactory. For a 4-star hotel, the lack of a restaurant or room service is unacceptable.

During our stay, we were having a Starbucks coffee while waiting for a taxi, and the hotel staff pointed out that we were not allowed to consume outside food or beverages on the premises. The irony is that the hotel doesn't even offer a restaurant service if you want to buy one. Such absurd policies are simply outrageous. You can avoid unpleasant experiences by choosing another hotel.

The room was embarrassingly small. The bed is pushed against the wall or window, which means if you are staying with a partner, one of you will have to crawl over the other to get in or out of bed. Cleaning around the mattress and sheets next to the wall is evidently neglected due to the cramped space.

Overall, the location is the only redeeming quality of this hotel. The service, room size, and cleanliness leave much to be desired. I recommend avoiding this hotel to save yourself from a disappointing stay.

Bed bugs and triple charged for taxes.  I stayed in Citizen M a couple of nights, while in Paris in September 2024.  Here are the positives:  Itâs very modern, clean, and well maintained, with a fashionable dining and bar area on the first floor and the sixteenth floor.  The breakfast is pretty good, and the staff are pleasant and helpful.  Overall, itâs a solid four-star hotel, especially for the price.  Here are the negatives.  I have been to over 35 countries and stayed in hotels in all of them; but in this hotel, I was bitten by bed bugs.  They were on the pillow of my bed.  The first night I only had one bite (and didnât know what it was); but on the second night, I had five bites, which grew large and swollen.  One of them was about 50% of the size of a golf ball.  After I left the hotel and went to Germany to see friends, I purchased antihistamine, but it still took a few days for the bites to heal and the swelling to go down.  I have never gotten bed bugs in any of the thousands of hotel rooms and Airbnbâs Iâve stayed in during the course of my life.  Second annoyance: Even though I was a solo traveler, I booked a room with a king-size bed, because Iâm almost two meters tall (6â6â).  Because Citizen M deemed my room to be for two people, even though I was traveling alone, they double charged me for Paris city taxes.  It was a double charge of only 18 euros, but I found it very annoying.  Why should I be charged twice for city taxes, if Iâm only one person?  Citizen M tried to make it up to me by giving me 18 euro in credit for drinks at the bar, but I donât really drink alcohol. Their menu carried a non-alcoholic beer, but they didnât have it in stock, so I thought the coupon wasnât that useful.  BTW, this was my fourth trip to Paris; I always get a king-sized bed since Iâm 6â6â; and Iâve never had this problem at any other Paris hotel.  And, finally, my booking with Agoda included taxes.  I showed Citizen M the booking. So, I paid taxes twice at the hotel and once through Agoda, so I ended up triple paying for taxes.  Because of the foregoing problems, the best I can give this place is two stars. Had I not been triple charged for taxes and gotten bed bugs, I would have given Citizen M five stars.

Conveniently located near Gare de Lyon station, the hotel is very easy to find and navigate. It's a partial service hotel with self check-in. There are staff to support but what they can do is more limited (help you with directions/recommendations around Paris, food and amenity orders, etc.)

The hotel has a sleek and artsy look and feel, but it does feel that it's simply using these design/brand quirks to cover up the fact that it's not a full-service hotel. It's not that much cheaper than some full-service alternatives.

The rooms are a bit small but more or less clean. Everything is operated via a tablet which is cool at first but becomes gimmicky later. Their app has bugs (we didn't have any TV channels for some time), and for some reason, guests are not able to turn off the room air conditioning. You can only lower fans and the max temp is only 24 degrees Celsius. For some, this can still be too cold and make someone ill.

As they probably have less staff on-site as a partial service hotel, no one ever picked up the phone whenever we called when we were outside the hotel and needed some help which was very disappointing.

While overall not the worst experience, and some cool quirks, at the end of the day, would not recommend staying here unless you get a really good deal or are specifically looking for this kind of experience.

Location was fantastic. Room was clean on arrival. Staff will not allow you to consume any food or beverage in the common areas. There is a lobby area with chairs, couches and tables for guests. We were told we could not consume our Starbucks or any other food/beverage item in that location unless we purchased it in their separate restaurant. We were asked to leave and go to our room.

Not the best choice we could have made.

I guess cleaning itâs an issue in this hotel, housekeeping was terrible, one day they totally forgot to clean our room, hallways and elevators are dirty, and as absolute climax the second night we stayed in, we saw a rat sneaking around the restaurant while we were eating,
For the price that weâve paid and the 4 stars that they claim itâs unacceptable.

Spend your money somewhere else.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello Matteo, 
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us, 
We are sorry your stay didn't match your expectation.
It's true room cleaning has previously been a mistunderstanding as the tablet requesting is not always well communicated and that is not what we aim for,
The cleanliness is always crucial and we will investigate the case mentionned to understand what could have happened behind the scenes. 
Once again, thank you for your feedback and we wish you a good day, 
Noor & The CitizenM Team

reviews.text:
Unfortunately, I do not share the positive reviews on this hotel.

The rooms are really narrow, almost too small for two people. Finding a simple trash can was not available/unclear for us. No cooking pot for teas and by default no extra water in the room. Minibar was empty. See-through shower stall walls, lack of toilet isolation and lack of hygiene spray for going to the toilet - not suitable when in a room with a friend or even as a couple. Very uncomfortable. Insufficient opportunity for fresh air, even with ventilation in the room.

Netflix and other apps are not pre installed on the TV. The connection was not possible on the TV via an iPhone, neither via Airplay nor Chromecast, despite instructions, so practically unusable. Who wants to watch random tv broadcast in 2023?

Upsides: The staff was superb. Nice and always helpful!
Room-wise, I liked the iPad and the settings options with the light and temperature above it. The bed was comfortable and overall the room was clean.

However, I would not stay longer than one night and will not return for the given price of 130â¬Â for two people for one night, no breakfast included, check-in by 2, check-out by 11.

2.5 stars of 5

The rooms are the smallest that i have every seen, hardly fitting a double bed, and no place to even walk without hitting something.

The bathrooms are again so small that if you don't open a shower door, you really cannot get in the bathroom.

You have to prebook cleaning.

The room is controlled by an ipad. If you are 5 year old, you may love the colored lights.

The breakfast has orange and apple juice, scrambled egg, bacon and roasted potatos.

The location is very good as its next to a train station.

Staff is generally good, but you won't be able to get anyone on the phone after 9 pm.

Their is no tea/coffee in the room.

Lifts are Well maintained and clean.

Its a city hotel so no fancy views.

I really really wish I could give this place a positive review because Paris was amazing and the staff were so nice but we had to move rooms 3 times because the door knobs kept breaking and we were approved for a late checkout of 6 PM because our train didnât leave until 7:30 but we got a call at 4 PM saying they needed us to leave ASAP because they were at 100% occupancy and need to flip the room.

Wanted to love it, but couldnât.

This CitizenM hotel gave us more of a hostel impression rather than of a 4 star hotel.

Weâve been assigned a room which had a lock forced, even though the door would close, part of the wood and paint were crashed/missing from the door. Later we found out that the previous guests suffered an intent of a robbery.

There were no amenities in the room, the reservation indicated a daily bottle of water which was nowhere to be seen. No cups or glasses to put our toothbrushes. Uncomfortable.

We booked a higher floor City View room, but windows need to be clean to actually enjoy the view. When the sun came through the window we could see so much dust in the room, even though we requested a cleaning through an app for one of the days, the room remained dusty.

At the cloudM the bartender was rude. The reception ambassador explained that we could order food at the canteenM on their first floor and take it to clouldM where we bought the drinks. The bartender called Benjamin told we couldnât have the food there since âthe concept was differentâ, there were only 3 people at the cloudM for a reason. He also tried to overcharge us for the beers we ordered.

At night, you can hear the doors slam at the rooms next door. During our last night there we couldnât sleep, since some of the guests partied throughout the night, coming in and out, slamming doors at 4am.

Overall I am giving it 2 stars because McKenzie at the reception was nice during the check-in and the bed is comfortable. But the experience was very different from the Amsterdam CitizenM hotel where I stayed years ago. What a disappointment.

Hello Thomas,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.

We are sorry to learn about the technical issues you encountered with TV and the blinds. Even though exceptional, unfortunately it can happen that technology fails.We  apologize for the inconvenience caused. Our team of ambassadors is available to support 24h/7 and look for solutions to make our guestsâ stay more comfortable. Have you reported it to our team during your stay?

Our technicians are looking into it to avoid this type of unpleasant experience for our guests in the future. Let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

Kind regards,
Maria & citizenM team

This hotel had great potential. However, three things spoiled my stay. First, my âroom with a viewâ was only halfway up the hotel, meaning the view was rather less spectacular than I expected. Second, all the windows had fly mesh fitted on the outside (despite not actually opening). This ruined all my attempts to take photos of the view. Third, due to coronavirus, the large breakfast buffet was replaced by a really poor âbreakfast in a bagâ worth maybe 3â¬. But they still charged me the full rate. So, I ended up paying extra for a bad view and a bad breakfast. Oh, and they overcharged me on arrival and Iâm still awaiting a refund for the difference.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Dear citizen Toby Moncaster,
Thank you for your review. Sorry to hear you are disappointed by the view and the fact that our windows cannot be opened. Our windows stay closed for safety reasons. Regarding the breakfast we are open to all your feedback so we can improve ourselves. The refund can take a few days however do not hesitate to reach out to us through our chat so we can follow up. Hopefully you will give a second chance. Until then safe travels, citizen Dagmar

reviews.text:
Hello citizen Philippe,

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay . We are happy to learn that  you found the room tidy and our decor.
We are sorry to learn that you were debited twice. After looking into what happened, we saw that you made 2 reservations for the same day. You checked in into one of the reservation and the other reservation became a no show which was charged.

We apologise that the view was not to your liking. Our ambassadors are always available for solutions, including a room change for  a better view should you request for it.
Please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can help with.

CitizenM team

I like the concept and didnât mind the small space because I was traveling solo. The staff were all very friendly too.  But I canât recommend this place because:

-Terrible sound proofing. I heard footsteps from neighboring rooms and doors slamming all night. I switched to another room and had the same problems. I had to take sleeping pills to fall asleep.

-Uncleanliness. There was dust and hair on the floor and in the corners of the bed. They also didnât change my sheets even after I left a note on the pillow asking them to (in French and English).

-The windows donât open, which adds to the feeling of claustrophobia.

-Breakfast is overpriced and the buffet has a very limited selection. The croissants were good though.

-The location is not great.  The proximity to Gare de Lyon train station is the only redeeming quality.

Overall, the experience felt gimmicky. I was glad to check out after spending 6 nights here.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Dear Blake N,
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We appreciate it because our guests' experience is our top priority and we get to learn from you how to make citizenM product and service better and better. Sorry to hear you were bothered by noise from neighboring rooms and that the level of cleanliness was not on top.
However, if at any time you notice something we should know about, please let one of our ambassadors know and we will try to solve the problem to the best of our abilities. Hopefully you will give us a second chance. Safe travels, citizen Dagmar

reviews.text: Television lose signal each 10 min. The I pod did not work. 337 euro for a mini room well I had more for less. Good point all is clean
Rooms are tiny, especially for over 300euro per nite. No bottled water or coffee making facilities in the room.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hello Citizen ROBERT,

We are sad that your experience did not match your expectations, and to be more precise the size of the room is a part of the company concept, and brand stance to make an optimum confort in the room with a big bed and to create comfy and artistic lobby in order to complete the experience in these huge space we have great proposition of coffees mannually made with warm love and artistic design available 24/7  in these same place there will always be ambassadors ready to give fresh filter water bottles at any moment can you can keep in the room! 

We hope that we will see you in order to offer you the experience with the CITIZENM context again 

Have a great day!!

reviews.text: No bathrobes, no teakettle, cleaning twice a week only and the TV was not working many times. Not bad but itâs not worth 4 stars.
Like a backpackers or student hostel, with the price of a 5* resort.

I totally Don t recommend this hotel, I was in a honey moon and I called the hotel to do special arrangements they promised everything about this but when I ve arrived the room was normal, really bad experience, the workers really unfriendly with the exception of Jorge that is really nice.
Nice hotel because its near the train station. However, the rooms is very small
A bit dated now - and lacking in some facilities. For the price, better can be found.
its motel. small rooms. no facilities
Good luck with garr de Lyon

HÃ´tel avec du personnel uniquement anglophone, dâoÃ¹ la grande difficultÃ© Ã  se faire comprendre pour des francophones

reviews.ownerResponse:

Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We appreciate the opportunity to learn from your experience and we are intent on improving for your future experiences. We understand that our bedrooms may be smaller in comparison with other hotels though we have designed them to ensure the necessities are there. A giant XL bed, powerful rain shower and working desk. We'd like to add that we listen to your feedback and we constantly review the designs of our rooms to meet modern travellers' expectations. While our existing hotels remain as they are, our new and future rooms may look different. 

Safe travels,
citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon

reviews.ownerResponse:
Hotel that claims to be modern on paper. Although the common areas are magnificent, the rooms are absolutely not suitable for a couple, the bed is located against a window, it is impossible to get up at night without waking the other partner, you have to climb over the bed. The bathroom is a kit placed in the room, the walls poorly insulated.

Finally, the service can largely be improved. I booked a room with tourist tax included. The staff has no autonomy and depends on a Citizen telephone platform which rarely picks up, the largely English-speaking staff were not able to understand that I had paid the taxes due and collected the taxes from me even though they had been paid (I should point out that I speak English very well however but that the platform had not correctly entered my reservation and my payment, I spent more than 30 minutes at reception talking at 10 p.m.â¦â¦.), it was necessary that I return to reception the next morning to be reimbursed for the tax that was wrongly collected from me the day before... A real problem of trust and service.
In short, I advise against it. There are much better options nearby at similar prices.

reviews.text: Hotel situato in unâottima posizione a Gare de Lyon a pochi passi dalla metro. Sicuramente molto innovativo e tecnologico, forse un poâ complicato per persone piÃ¹ anziane siccome nessuno ti spiega niente. Al primo giorno sembrava tutto perfetto, stanza pulita e in ordine fino a quando sono sorti i primi problemi. Abbiamo soggiornato per 5 giorni, e giorno dopo giorno la polvere continuava ad accumularsi. Le pulizie giornaliere (impostabili dal tablet) comprendevano la pulizia del lavandino, bagno e cambio del letto (un giorno sÃ¬ e uno no). Addirittura una sera siamo tornati in camera con il letto ancora disfatto e con i vestiti buttati sulla sedia. La cosa piÃ¹ grave Ã¨ stata la presenza di una costante aria fredda proveniente dalla ventilazione allâinterno della stanza impossibile da regolare anche dal tablet. Nonostante ci siamo lamentati con il receptionist, la situazione non Ã¨ cambiata di molto anche perchÃ© purtroppo passa aria dalla finestra attaccata al letto. reviews.ownerResponse: Hotel located in an excellent location in Gare de Lyon a few steps from the metro. Certainly very innovative and technological, perhaps a little complicated for older people since no one explains anything to you. On the first day everything seemed perfect, the room was clean and tidy until the first problems arose. We stayed for 5 days, and day after day the dust kept accumulating. Daily cleaning (settable from the tablet) included cleaning the sink, bathroom and changing the bed (every other day). One evening we even returned to the room with the bed still unmade and with our clothes thrown on the chair. There is no courtesy kit (not even slippers and shower gel!) and the presence of electrical sockets inside the room is very limited (3 sockets for 2 people). The most serious thing was the presence of constant cold air coming from the ventilation inside the room which was impossible to regulate even from the tablet. Although we complained to the receptionist, the situation hasn't changed much also because unfortunately air passes through the window attached to the bed. Room nice to my taste even if not too spacious. Good price for 4 nights a few kilometers from the center without counting breakfast.

In addition, my account has just been debited for a tax (what is the nature of it?)
The only positive point is the location, very close to Gare de Lyon.
We will not repeat the experience in this hotel.

reviews.text:
Service lamentable, pour le check-in c'est devant un ordinateur que Ã§a se passe. Avec un personnel qui te regarde et ne dis pas un mot.
Pour 2 nuits passÃ© 100 euros de frais supplÃ©mentaires injustifiÃ©s.
Aucune possibilitÃ© de rÃ©gler par cash (rien n'est indiquÃ© sur le site).

Le repas du soir est minable. Le menu est trÃ¨s restreint (env. 5 plats). Aucun service Ã  table, on doit commandÃ© au bar et chercher sa commande. Pizzas surgelÃ©es, prÃ©sence d'aliments allergÃ¨nes non-prÃ©cisÃ©s sur la carte. Plateau charcuterie/fromages Ã  18 euros pour du plastique fade, cornichons mutants. 112 euros pour un repas bas de gamme et dÃ©cevant.

Chambre trÃ¨s bien, cependant un chauffage plus que mÃ©diocre. Une cabine de douche collÃ©e aux toilettes pas super bien pensÃ©.

Aucun employÃ©s parle clairement franÃ§ais, parler anglais pour vous faire comprendre (inattendu pour un hÃ´tel en pleine capital).
reviews.ownerResponse:
Terrible service, for check-in it happens in front of a computer. With staff who look at you and don't say a word.
For 2 nights spent 100 euros in unjustified additional costs.
No possibility of paying by cash (nothing is indicated on the site).

The evening meal is lousy. The menu is very limited (approx. 5 dishes). No table service, you have to order at the bar and pick up your order. Frozen pizzas, presence of allergenic foods not specified on the menu. Charcuterie/cheese platter for 18 euros for bland plastic, mutant pickles. 112 euros for a low-end and disappointing meal.

Room very good, however heating is more than mediocre. A shower cubicle next to the toilet not very well thought out.

None of the employees speak French clearly, speaking English to make you understood (unexpected for a hotel in the heart of the capital).

reviews.text:
Chambre convenable (mais pour un 4*, discutable)
Une chose impensable est de savoir que la langue de communication premiÃ¨re est l'anglais. Bilingue bien entendu, mais en tant que FranÃ§ais j'ai l'impression d'Ãªtre  Ã  l'Ã©tranger : menu sur la tÃ©lÃ© en Anglais, courriel de rÃ©servation et de confirmation en Anglais... Tout cela me semble hors du cadre lÃ©gal, je m'interroge pour un signalement.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Decent room (but for a 4-star hotel, questionable)

Bilingual, of course, but as a French person, I feel like I'm abroad: the menu on the TV is in English, the reservation and confirmation emails are in English... All of this seems outside the legal framework; I'm wondering about reporting it.

Modern design but the room is small, the bed takes up all the space and doesn't even allow you to look out the window. Everything is managed via a tablet, even the television which, when you finally manage to turn it on, turns off by itself after a few minutes. No kettle or even a bottle of water in the fridge. No wardrobe... In short, very surprised that this hotel has 4 stars...

reviews.text:
Habitaciones pequeÃ±as y sin ventilar que se controlan mediante ipad. BaÃ±o y aseo en el mismo receptÃ¡culo de cristal translÃºcido.
Las toallas son escasas.
No limpian la habitaciÃ³n todos los dÃ­as y el trato al cliente es bastante impersonal. Se echa de menos una botella de agua en la habitaciÃ³n aunque si la pides en el bar te la dan sin ningÃºn costo.
A su favor he de decir que es bastante tranquilo y estÃ¡ bien comunicado porque tiene cerca el metro y parada de autobÃºs.
No merece las 4 estrellas que tiene pero visto lo visto y comparando lo que te puedes encontrar por aquÃ­ yo dirÃ­a que es una buena opciÃ³n para alojarse ya que la mayorÃ­a de hoteles de Paris son caros y ofrecen menos servicios.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Small, unventilated rooms that are controlled by iPad. Bathroom and toilet in the same translucent glass receptacle.
Towels are scarce.
They don't clean the room every day and the customer service is quite impersonal. We miss a bottle of water in the room although if you ask for it at the bar they will give it to you at no cost.
In its favor I have to say that it is quite quiet and is well connected because it has the metro and bus stop nearby.
It doesn't deserve the 4 stars it has, but given what I've seen and comparing what you can find here, I would say that it is a good option to stay since most hotels in Paris are expensive and offer fewer services.

reviews.text:

reviews.ownerResponse:

reviews.text: No es un concepto de hotel para mi. No volveria. reviews.ownerResponse: It is not a hotel concept for me. I wouldn't go back. At 7:00 the street worker woke up drilling the asphalt and to iron I had to go down with the clothes a few floors below to get to a room with the iron because they don't provide it to the room, yes, they don't clean the rooms daily and it is very far from down town. I spent a lot of money and time to pay for Bolt.

reviews.ownerResponse: As a regular at the Citizen M in Geneva, which is truly beautiful, comfortable, and spotlessly clean, I naturally booked the one in Paris, expecting to find the same services, the same quality, and the same friendliness of the staff. But that was not the case at all! The staff is completely lost, not friendly, most of them don't speak French, and above all, they don't feel at all concerned about the well-being of the guests. My room was barely heated; even when I turned the heating up full blast, I was cold. It was clean, as long as you didn't look in the corners. The shower curtain was hanging crooked and the shower head leaked everywhere, so much so that the bathroom was well flooded by a quick shower. I wanted to go and do some work in the living room, but there was a man installing decorations and it was very noisy. The breakfast is okay, but nothing more. A cappuccino is nothing more than a latte. In Geneva, a barista prepares hot drinks with care, and they're delicious. In short, a disappointing hotel, overpriced for what it is. And that's a shame, because the concept is good. It just goes to show that you can belong to the same chain but not offer the same quality.

reviews.ownerResponse: Quite honestly, I was disappointed by my stay in this design hotel, although it was very well rated! The welcome is warm, as are the shared spaces (lounge, coworking, breakfast). For the rest, it's disappointing. The room is tiny (very small wardrobe, no drawer, sink in the room). The view is beautiful from the window (from the side, you can see the Seine, the Montparnasse tower, the Pantheon, etc.) but the bed placed right next to it blocks the way... The shower was lukewarm for 2 days despite our complaints; it was then repaired and became hot again for the remainder of the stay. On the other hand, the TV, a pretty flat screen, never worked and yet we reported it every morning at reception!!! Let's end with 2 positive points: the bedding is of excellent quality and the room is perfectly soundproofed. But I will not return to this hotel: in this price range (130 euros per night without breakfast), there are other hotels in the Gare de Lyon district, more comfortable.

reviews.ownerResponse:
The room was sooo ... After checking out after 2 nights, I asked why I had to pay because I had to go to Lyon Station on time in the morning, and they said they wanted me to pay for the food. ã 
We ate everything the first night and paid right away..

I explained the situation and said we weren't here at that time and slept at Pullman, but the staff just kept repeating that they didn't know. ã 

In the end, we didn't pay, but we only calculated the time it took to get to the station and left, and then we moved in a hurry. 

We were busy, but it's a shame that the staff couldn't respond quickly because they were talking among themselves. 

It's very close to Lyon Station, so the distance is good.

reviews.text:
Hotel dÃ©shumanisÃ©, bienvenu a gattaca dans un monde insipide et aseptisÃ©.

reviews.ownerResponse:

The staff is competent, the room is clean.
Tablets for check-in, tablets for check-out, tablets to control an air conditioner that won't turn off, a tablet to close the shutters. The windows can't be opened. reviews.text:

HÃ´tel qui ce veut hightec mais au dÃ©triment du service client. AdaptÃ© pour clientÃ¨le touristique de passage mais pas vraiment pour un sÃ©jour Business. CÃ´tÃ© restaurant c'est de la cuisine micro ondes sans intÃ©rÃªt. Breakfast, trop long car pas de machine Ã  cafÃ© en self service.

It's not a four star especially as the entrance (elevator on the ground floor) and the sink open to the room smell like sewers. It's high-tech yes, but that's not enough.

reviews.text: Un peu dÃ©Ã§u . On a ajoutÃ© l option pour Ãªtre en hauteur avec une vue et on nous dÃ©livre une chambre au 4eme Ã©tage . reviews.ownerResponse: A little disappointed. We added the option to be high up with a view and we were given a room on the 4th floor. Hotel review ok but far from what we had experienced at the citizen in New York

reviews.text: HÃ´tel bien mais restauration Ã  fuir! L accueil n est pas digne d'un 4 Ã©toiles et bien ai contraire, on a l'impression d avoir Ã  faire au staff de McDonald's. La carte prÃ©sentÃ© des plats tous rechauffÃ©s...bref c'Ã©tait dÃ©gueu. Ossobuco et risotto gambas. Les pires jamais mangÃ©s. La chambre est bien, design et moderne mais trÃ¨s petite.
